Description: This is a lush and hearty take on Sangiovese, beginning with aromas of black currant, caramel, dried purple flowers, salted meats and coffee cream. The palate is tense right away, which gives structure to the liquid violet and black-cherry-laced coffee-cream flavors. The tannins are firm but polished, and acidity drives deep into the finish.
Name: Desparada 2015 Death & Resurrection Sangiovese (California)

Description: Made entirely with organically grown Sangiovese and aged in tonneaux, this has aromas of scorched earth, spiced plum, grilled herb and leather. The polished, enveloping palate doles out mature Marasca cherry, raspberry, licorice and tobacco while a hint of crushed mint provides back up. Velvety tannins give it structure and smooth texture while a note of blood orange lingers on the close. Drink through 2025.
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2015 Vigna Vecchia Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Vibrant and silky, this pure expression of Sangiovese is all about finesse, starting with alluring scents of wild berry, crushed rose petal, tilled earth, aromatic herb and new leather. The elegant, linear palate is almost ethereal, offering juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper set against firm, refined tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Enjoy now or hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2026.
Name: Castell'In Villa 2014  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, exotic spice, blue flower and menthol shape the nose. It's linear, focused and ethereally elegant, offering succulent Morello cherry, raspberry compote and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Felsina 2016 Fontalloro Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: This Sangiovese offers enticing scents of black-skinned berry, cedar and underbrush. The juicy, elegant palate delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside supple, polished tannins. Drink through 2026.
Name: Fattoria Le Pupille 2015 Poggio Valente Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made exclusively with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of French oak and black-skinned fruit. The elegantly structured palate presents ripe Marasca cherry, cranberry, oak-driven spice, orange peel and hints of coconut alongside fine-grained tannins that give the finish some grip.
Name: San Felice 2015 Poggiorosso Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, new leather and a whiff of cake spice take center stage on this elegant red. Linear and focused, the palate offers dried cherry, crushed botanical herb, star anise and a hint of rusty iron alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Basilica Cafaggio 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, vanilla, cooking spice and a touch of eucalyptus. The juicy, balanced palate delivers raspberry jam, star anise, white pepper and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2026.
Name: Castello di Gabbiano 2015 Bellezza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of dark berry, cedar and eucalyptus. The savory palate offers black plum, white pepper and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.
Name: Carobbio 2013 Leone Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made with Sangiovese, this focused red opens with aromas of French oak, scorched earth, new leather and mature black-skinned fruit. The firm, linear palate offers dried Morello cherry, espresso, coconut and star anise set against tight, fine-grained tannins that need time to unwind. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Avignonesi 2015 Grandi Annate Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of clove, woodland berry and a suggestion of new leather mingle with a whiff of pressed rose. On the linear palate, easy-drinking palate, elegant tannins accompany wild cherry and a hint of star anise. Drink through 2021.
Name: Basilica Cafaggio 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Enticing scents of violet, wild berry, Mediterranean herb and baking spice lead the nose. Smooth and structured, the palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, blackberry and clove while fine-grained tannins lend taut support. A coffee bean note marks the close.
Name: Vignamaggio 2015 Sangiovese di Vitigliano Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of coffee, oak, toast and baked plum lead the nose. On the palate, tight, taut tannins underscore dried cherry, espresso and grilled sage. Drink over the next several years.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Montesodi Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red berry, leather and underbrush. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside pliant tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: This Sangiovese opens with aromas of forest floor, cooking spice and red plum. The juicy palate delivers raspberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.
Name: Losi Querciavalle 2013 Armonia Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, tilled soil and leather. The chewy palate delivers mature black plum, tobacco and white pepper alongside smooth, ripe tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2013 Sòdole Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Cinnamon and stalk aromas lead the way, followed closely by almost candied red fruits and florals. The varietal character is more apparent on the medium-bodied palate, where a tobacco leaf flavor joins oodles of juicy red berries backed by crunchy acidity and tightly grained, leathery tannins.
Name: Point Ormond 2017 Sangiovese (Grampians)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a compelling gravelly minerality on the nose of this bottling along with aromas of black cherry and black plum. The palate is rich yet tart with sour cherry flavors as well as oregano and fennel bulb.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Bell pepper, cassis, oak and exotic spice aromas follow over to the medium-bodied palate along with licorice and dried cherry. Fine-grained tannins provide support.
Name: Tenuta di Nozzole 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Boushey (62%) and Seven Hills vineyards. The aromas dazzle, with fruit-forward notes of raspberry, red cherry and cranberry along with cedar and spice accents. There's a lovely sense of purity and elegance to the palate, with tart fruit flavors. The tannins give a firm handshake, softening over time. It's a delightful, elegant expression of the variety. Put it on the dinner table to see it shine.
Name: Covington 2016 Sangio Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with red berry and baking spice aromas while the medium-bodied palate shows red cherry, vanilla and clove. Smooth tannins offer light support. Artisanal Cellars and Opera Wine Imports.
Name: Fattoria Fibbiano 2014 Sanforte Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with vinous aromas of just pressed grapes, wild berry and plum that mingle with whiffs of blue flower and dark spice. The vigorous palate offers juicy wild cherry, raspberry and clove alongside fresh acidity and supple tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Tenuta San Vito 2017 San Vito  (Chianti)

Description: Made with Sangiovese, this has aromas of cedar, tobacco and a hint of dark-skinned fruit. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied, straightforward palate along with a hint of clove and smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Castello Sonnino 2014 Cantinino Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Red berry and baking spice aromas lead the nose along with a note of tilled earth. The easygoing palate reflects the nose, offering dried Marasca cherry and clove alongside pliant tannins. Drink now.
Name: Basilica Cafaggio 2017 Single Estate  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Here's a bright, easy-drinking red that has flavors of juicy wild cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside pliant tannins and fresh acidity. Straightforward and juicy, it's ideal for everyday enjoyment. Drink now.
Name: Basilica Cafaggio 2016 Pigro  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This Sangiovese has subdued aromas of red fruit and vanilla. The straightforward palate offers red plum, toasted oak and clove alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Colle S. Mustiola di Fabio Cenni 2010 Poggio ai Chiari Sangiovese (Toscana)
Winery: Colle S. Mustiola di Fabio Cenni

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The tire rubber, cherry, vanilla and wood spice aromas don't seem entirely settled at present—surprising given the extra time in bottle. Light, tart, puckering fruit flavors follow. The acidity is delightful if the aromas clear up.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2014 V Cut Bank Estate Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of pressed rose, prune and medicinal herb lead the nose. The palate isn't very expressive, suggesting dried cherry and powdered sage alongside dusty, fleeting tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017  Chianti

Description: This has aromas of ripe berry, a suggestion of dark spice and whiffs of wild herb. The aromas carry over to the simple palate alongside dusty, rather fleeting tannins.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of French oak and spiced plum lead the nose. The firm palate shows star anise, a bitter note of powdered sage and the merest hint of prune while astringent tannins leave a tight, drying finish. Despite the assertive tannins drink soon before what little fruit remains dries out completely.
Name: Podere La Cappella 2013 Corbezzolo Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: This offers aromas suggestive of violet and wild berry. It's informal, with flavors of ripe cherry, clove and a hint of dried herb accompanied by dusty, somewhat fleeting tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink now.
Name: Casa Catelli 2016  Chianti

Description: Lightly scented, this eventually reveals whiffs of wild berry, blue flower and a hint of damp earth. On the lean palate, you'll find dried cherry and sage accompanied by drying, somewhat fleeting tannins.
Name: Castellani 2016 Genius Loci Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: This extremely simple Sangiovese has subdued aromas of violet and a whiff of berry while the light-bodied palate suggests dried cherry and a bitter note of powdered sage. Drink now.
Name: Bellini 2017 Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Made from Sangiovese, this has subdued aromas of red berry and cooking spice. Mirroring the nose, the simple palate delivers raspberry and clove alongside easygoing tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Il Bastardo 2017 Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of ripe blackberry, weedy underbrush and a whiff of botanical herb lead the nose. The simple palate shows black cherry and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside pliant tannins. Drink now.
Name: Canaletto 2017  Chianti

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Electric pink in color, the aromas offer notes of apple and lees. Thick feeling, medium-bodied flavors follow, with a lightly smoky finish after.
Designation: Blondie Elephant Mountain Vineyard Rosé of
Name: Finn Hill 2017 Blondie Elephant Mountain Vineyard Rosé of Sangiovese (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of barnyard, dried cherry, dried tobacco and herb are followed by somewhat lighter-styled fruit flavors that show the same. It doesn't come together, and the variety seems impossible to find.
Name: Plumb Cellars 2014 Estate JK Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Perfumed berry, tilled earth, pressed rose, new leather, cake spice and a balsamic note are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant, delicious red. It's linear, structured and loaded with finesse, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Taut refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an age-worthy framework. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Salcheto 2015 Vecchie Viti del Salco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers enticing aromas of exotic spice, ripe black-skinned fruit, tilled soil, French oak and a whiff of leather. The full-bodied palate boasts structure, elegance and tension, delivering juicy wild cherry, raspberry, star anise and espresso set against firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Boscarelli 2015 Costa Grande  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Ripe plum, wild berry, new leather and exotic spice mingle with a whiff of French oak. Young, taut and elegantly structured, the palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, cassis, orange zest, star anise and clove framed in tightly knit fine-grained tannins. Give it time to fully come around and you'll be rewarded with even more complexity. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: La Braccesca 2015 Maggiarino  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, this fragrant elegant red opens with enticing scents of underbrush, sunbaked earth, wild berry, violet, crushed mint and a balsamic whiff of camphor. Smooth and savory, the linear palate has surprising vibrancy for such a hot vintage, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper. Elegant fine-grained tannins lend polished support while a coffee note lingers on the close. Drink through 2025.
Name: Salcheto 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, culinary spice, tobacco, new leather and an earthy whiff of tilled soil emerge in the glass. Elegantly structured, the savory linear palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, black raspberry, star anise and dried botanical herb. Polished fine-grained tannins lend lithe support while fresh acidity provides plenty of verve. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Salcheto 2013 Salco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Combining structure and finesse, this offers aromas of spiced plum, underbrush, French oak and pipe tobacco. It's full bodied and smooth but also has tension, evoking mature black cherry, prune, mocha, licorice and clove framed in firm close-grained tannins. It closes on a coffee-bean note. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Poliziano 2015 La Caggiole  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Alluring aromas of black-skinned berry, forest floor, oak and exotic spice shape the nose. On the elegantly structured, focused palate, polished fine-grained tannins support dried black cherry, raspberry compote, clove and cinnamon while a hint of espresso lingers on the close. It's already tempting, but give it a few more years to develop even more complexity. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Avignonesi 2015 Progetto di Sopra  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Fragrant and refined, this elegant red offers enticing scents of woodland berry, pressed rose, violet and culinary spice. The polished focused palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and clove set against precise fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Trerose 2016 Vigna Santa Caterina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A pure expression of Sangiovese, this has aromas of ripe red berry, violet, star anise and a whiff of crushed herb. Tight and focused, the youthfully austere vibrant palate evokes Marasca cherry, pomegranate, licorice and ground clove while firm fine-grained tannins provide a polished backbone. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Valdipiatta 2016 Vigna d'Alfiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Initially rather shy, this eventually offers aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, pipe tobacco and a whiff of new leather. The enveloping palate evokes dried cherry, prune, clove and a note of star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Boscarelli 2015 Il Nocio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Baked plum, exotic spice, leather and a whiff of French oak mingle with a suggestion of fragrant blue flower. The firm elegant palate delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and baking spice before a coffee finish. Taut fine-grained tannins provide structure while fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Trerose 2013 Simposio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, exotic spice and mature black-skinned fruit shape the nose along with a whiff of menthol. The enveloping palate shows flair and finesse, offering dried black cherry, prune steeped in spirits, cinnamon and licorice set against firm fine-grained tannins. An espresso note lingers on the close.
Name: Dei 2013 Bossona Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Wild-berry, new leather, truffle and clove aromas take center stage. Smooth and savory, the linear palate shows dried Marasca cherry, mature plum and licorice set against taut refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari 2015 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Leather, graphite, crushed herb and spiced plum aromas lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the palate along with dried cherry, oak and star anise while polished tannins lend support. Drink through 2025.
Name: Lunadoro 2015 Pagliareto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Earthy and savory, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, pressed violet, baking spice and a whiff of sunbaked earth. The aromas follow over to the easygoing generous palate along with ripe plum and clove. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Salcheto 2017 Obvius Sangiovese (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Spiced plum, star anise, menthol and sunbaked forest-floor aromas lead the nose. It's big and chewy, with dried cherry, prune extract, licorice and tobacco set against fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol on the finish. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Le Bèrne 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: French oak, prune, new leather and dark culinary-spice aromas set the tone. It's taut, linear and focused, offering dried cherry, star anise, tobacco and espresso set against a backbone of firm close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Poggio alla Sala 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas evoking baked plum, exotic spice, new leather and coconut. The taut palate offers French oak, prune, dried cherry, espresso and licorice framed in tight close-grained tannins that give it a firm drying finish.
Name: Talosa 2015 Filai Lunghi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: French oak, mature plum, roasted coffee-bean and coconut aromas form the nose. The aromas carry over to the firm austere palate along with prune, vanilla and a hint of mocha. Tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave a drying finish. Give the tannins another few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Poggio alla Sala 2015 Parceto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, toast, culinary spice and a whiff of leather shape the nose. On the soft enveloping palate, supple tannins accompany fleshy morello cherry, clove and a hint of espresso. Drink through 2021.
Name: Roccapesta 2013 Castelia  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of tilled soil, coconut, French oak and mature plum shape the nose. It's taut, linear and lean, evoking dried cherry, prune, licorice and crushed thyme alongside a roasted coffee-bean note. Drying grainy tannins grip the assertive finish.
Name: Fattoria della Talosa 2014 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of scorched soil, underbrush, leather, spiced prune and a whiff of toasted nut follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry and a hint of powdered sage. Dusty tannins leave a drying finish.
Name: Gattavecchi 2015 Riserva dei Padri Serviti  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Plum-cake, French oak, rose and leather aromas lift out of the glass. The oak aroma carries over to the palate, along with dried cherry, licorice and espresso. It's rather austere, with tight close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: De' Ricci Cantine Storiche 2015 Soraldo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Truffle, forest floor, grilled herb and a whiff of mature plum lead the nose. The solid juicy palate presents dried Marasca cherry, ripe cranberry and hints of baking spice framed in rounded fine-grained tannins that leave a drying close.
Name: Val di Toro 2015 Reviresco Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: Underbrush, pressed iris and baked plum aromas come together on this. It's round and soft, offering flavors of prune, dried cherry and hints of coffee and clove while round pliant tannins give light support. Drink soon.
Name: Santa Lucia 2015 Tore del Moro Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: Scorched earth, eucalyptus, wild berry and a whiff of blue flower emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate evokes ripe morello cherry, baking spice and star anise framed in lithe tannins.
Name: Val di Toro 2016 Reviresco  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of gun smoke, herb, raspberry, cranberry and fire pit are followed by sweet, well-balanced raspberry jam flavors. There is a lot to like.
Name: Casa Smith 2016 Cinghiale Wahluke Slope & Rosebud Vineyards Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Wild-berry, tobacco, clove and truffle aromas mingle with a whiff of oak. Lean and linear, the palate offers dried cherry, orange zest, toast, oak-driven spice and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: De' Ricci Cantine Storiche 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Aromas of ripe woodland berry, eucalyptus, violet and Mediterranean scrub lead the way. The tight linear palate offers mature Marasca cherry, dried sage and star anise framed in dusty, rather astringent tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Poggio Maestrino e Spiaggiole 2016 Poggio Maestrino Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of French oak, coconut and spiced plum. It's full bodied but lean, offering prune, oak-driven spice, thyme and espresso but it's shy on fruit richness. Grainy tannins leave an astringent finish.
Name: Lombardo 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: This offers aromas of pressed violet, berry and a whiff of dark spice. Mirroring the nose, the straightforward palate evokes dried black cherry, star anise and powdered sage alongside dusty grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Sicomoro Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking camphor, grilled herb, ripe berry and a whiff of cellar floor. The taut palate offers star anise, eucalyptus and dried cherry alongside taut dusty tannins that leave a firm drying finish.
Name: Villa Poggio Salvi 2016 Vaio  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: Red berry, violet and a whiff of baking spice shape the nose. The straightforward palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, clove and ground pepper alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Poggio al Lupo 2017  Morellino di Scansano

Description: Aromas of baked plum, roasted coffee bean, grilled herb and French oak lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers prune, dried cherry, grilled sage and espresso alongside close-grained but rather fleeting tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Santa Lucia 2016 Tore del Moro  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of scorched earth, underbrush, leather and wild berry. On the palate, dusty drying tannins accompany dried black cherry, powdered aromatic herb and ground clove. Drink soon.
Name: Poggio Maestrino e Spiaggiole 2017 Spiaggiole  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Scorched underbrush, new leather, steeped prune and exotic spice aromas come to the forefront. Buffed and lean, the taut light-bodied palate offers dried cherry, clove, powdered sage and a hint of espresso alongside dusty but not very persistent tannins that still leave a drying finish.
Name: Fattoria Svetoni 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Easygoing and savory, this juicy red doles out ripe Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and cinnamon flavors. Soft round tannins lend light support. Drink now.
Name: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2017 Vigna Benefizio  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of stewed prune, carob, leather and a whiff of truffle. The firm palate is already evolved, offering dried cherry, powdered thyme, toast and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that leave a drying, dusty finish.
Name: Lombardo 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Scorched earth, truffle, sea-breeze and overripe berry aromas lead the nose along with whiffs of barnyard. Reflecting the nose, the soft palate offers fleshy black cherry and gamy notes alongside hints of baking spice. Rounded but rather dusty tannins provide easygoing support. It's definitely earthy, with a rustic charm.
Name: Terre di Talamo 2016 Tempo  (Morellino di Scansano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has aromas of stewed prune, spearmint and a whiff of scorched earth. The lively if rather rustic, simple palate offers raisin and licorice alongside dusty tannins.
Name: Castellani 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: This has aromas of toasted oak, mocha and a whiff of smoke. The firm palate is rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, toast and oak-driven spice alongside assertive tannins that leave a drying finish. You'll also notice a green note of powdered sage on the close.
Name: Provveditore 2016  Morellino di Scansano

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Griffin Creek vineyard, this wine seems to have been built upon rather thin fruit flavors. Dilute, generic hints of red berry, along with herbal tomato leaf, are all but buried in a wash of vanilla. No information was provided, but often it's overuse of oak chips that bring on such flavors. Drink up.
Name: Panache Cellars 2015 Sangiovese (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Estrella District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and joyous Bing cherry aromas meet with nutmeg and gingerbread on the extremely accessible nose of this bottling. It's really juicy and lovable on the palate, where playful cherry and strawberry flavors are framed by slate-driven minerality, tense tannins and strong acidity.
Name: Pianetta 2016 Sangiovese (Paso Robles Estrella District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense and tarry in style, this bottling starts with deep aromas of boysenberry. There is a compelling density and intensity to the sip, where dark berries meet with damp tarragon flavors.
Name: Figge 2015 Foster's Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The cedar, sandalwood and pine-forest aromas work well on the Sangiovese in this bottling, which also shows red cherry on the nose. There is good tannic tightness to the palate, where red-fruit flavors meet with sawdust and vanilla on the finish.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Candied cherries, hibiscus, sumac and light clove aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. Dried strawberry flavors meet with mint and garden herbs on the aromatic palate.
Name: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Private Reserve Sangiovese (Temecula)

Description: This wine offers all of the cherry, tobacco, floral, and herbal notes we've come to love from Tuscany's most famous grape variety. And like many Italian reds, it's not shy when it comes to acid and tannins, the latter being raspy and tightly wound. There's fruit weight, however, which gives your mouth some relief from the tannic grip. This wine needs food, preferably a steaming bowl of pasta and meatballs.
Name: Loom 2014 SV Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh plum fruit meets with rocky earth, pipe tobacco and dark-red flowers on the nose of this bottling by Brian and Stephy Terrizzi. The palate is wrapped in a dark earthy core with bountiful acidity and thick tannins, carrying flavors of tangy plum skin and berry fruit.
Name: Giornata 2015 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Description: Juicy in cherry with a strong element of char and smoke, this is a soft, rounded and full-bodied wine made entirely from the variety. It has secondary characteristics of dried herb and sage.
Name: Pestoni Family 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Rutherford)

Description: Aromas of crushed stone, pressed rose and wild berry delicately lift out of the glass along with an earthy forest floor note and a whiff of bread crust. Reflecting the nose, the dry, vibrant palate offers strawberry, wild cherry, citrus and a mineral note of oyster shell alongside racy acidity and a refined perlage.
Name: Usiglian del Vescovo NV Il Bruvè Metodo Classico Sangiovese (Vino Spumante)

Description: A nice representation of what the grape can do in California, this is blended with 19% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. The result is juicy, leathery and soft in texture, with well-defined notes of dried currant, cherry and a lasting tease of sage.
Name: Pride Mountain 2015 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)

Description: Jammy in rustic dried cherry and blueberry, this is a likably soft, rounded and full-bodied red with a leathery finish dotted in black pepper and clove.
Name: Luna 2015 Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark strawberry, gingerbread spice, toast and gravel show on the nose of this relatively light bottling. Rounded and ripe plum and boysenberry flavors are lifted by cinnamon spice on the palate.
Name: Alara 2016 Sangiovese (San Benito County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has pleasant red-cherry and sour-cherry aromas, a plush mouthfeel and mellow ripe fruit flavors. Moderate acidity and tannins give it some good heft in the texture.
Name: Naggiar 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Ripe blueberry, prune and baked blackberry aromas are a touch soft on the nose. Ripe blueberry and pomegranate flavors are juicy and come with plenty of acidity, while gritty tannins bring along black pepper spice. Mouthwatering cranberry acidity surrounds sandy tannins and black pepper on the lingering finish.
Name: Messina Hof 2016 Artist Series Sangiovese (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 10% Merlot, this wine is brawny in baked and dried flavors of blueberry and cherry, its texture soft and rounded with a moderate amount of richness. There's both tension and balance in its acidity.
Name: Mietz 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The nose offers black plum, prune, black currant and blackberry, with subtler suggestions of nutmeg and vanilla. The palate is not as heavy, lightened by ample acidity while crushed-velvet tannins coat the mouth. Flavors of baked cherry, fresh blueberry and cranberry are bright on the palate, while nutmeg and vanilla gain traction. The lingering finish turns juicy, loaded with a red berry flavor and sandy tannis.
Name: Llano Estacado 2014 THP Sangiovese (Texas High Plains)

Description: The nose is earthy in tones of cinnamon and licorice, with vanilla and sandalwood. The palate shows sweet baking spice, wild forest berry, vanilla and cinnamon supported by sturdy, woody tannins and buoyant acidity. Tart cranberry and dusty tannins close out the lingering finish.
Name: Messina Hof 2015 Artists Reserve Sangiovese (Texas)

Description: With a nose of brioche and smoky oak, this is a well-made, light-bodied version of the variety with 3% Syrah blended in. Dried cherry, leather and black pepper all appear along a high-toned, tannic texture.
Name: Benessere 2016 Estate Sangiovese (St. Helena)

Description: A blue fruit aroma bursts from the glass. The palate offers inviting juicy blueberry and plum, bolstered by gritty tannins. The fruit flavors finish spicy and tannnic.
Name: McPherson 2015 Sangiovese (Texas)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an ashy undercurrent of char and smoke, this wine offers medium-bodied layers of dried cherry and leather, finishing with a lasting note of black pepper.
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Alegria Vineyards Sangiovese (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cranberry, white pepper, dried herbs and wet gravel make for a complex aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. Bright flavors of red cherry, oregano and rose petals give depth to the lighter-bodied style and make it quite easy to quaff.
Name: Koehler 2015 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Winemaker Greg Graziano put a smooth polish on this medium- to full-bodied wine, adding light oak-spice notes to good, ripe red- and black-cherry and black-olive flavors. A smooth, mouth-filling texture makes it soothing to sip.
Name: Monte Volpe 2014 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from esteemed Boushey, Red Willow and Alder Ridge vineyards. Aromas of sour cherry, herb and spice are followed by tart, bright fruit flavors backed by a firm lick of tannins.
Name: Cavatappi 2014 Molly's Cuvée Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This maverick medium-bodied wine has leathery aromas, a touch of iodine in the sour cherry flavors and a firm, moderately tannic texture. The wine is big and brawny in mouthfeel and not very oaky.
Name: Prima Materia 2015 Sangiovese

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is well-balanced, moderately flavorful and has a good, gripping texture. Light red cherry and cranberry are the flavor focal points.
Name: Kendric 2015 Reward Ranch Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a smooth and rounded red with friendly fruit flavors and hints of butter and vanilla. Medium bodied and not too concentrated, it's easy to sip.
Name: Via Romano 2014 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas and herbal, iron-like flavors of mineral and tomato highlight this medium-bodied, lightly tannic and mature wine.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2012 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark cherry and cranberry scents mesh with wood-spice and forest undergrowth aromas on the nose of this bottling from a region that's starting to gain more attention. Chalky tannins provide a very firm structure on the palate, certainly due to the 28 months of French oak aging. Strong acidity slices through the red-fruit and allspice flavors. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Bella Luna 2013 Grosso Siletto Vineyards Sangiovese (San Benito County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petal, potpourri, red cherry and vanilla make for an elegant entry to this bottling, which spent 26 months in neutral French oak. There is decent structure to the palate, where cranberry and red-cherry flavors decorate roasted meat and violet touches.
Name: Midnight 2014 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Plump black-currant, wood oil and licorice aromas show on the fairly ripe and deep nose of this bottling from northern San Diego County. Tannins rise quickly as does prominent acid on the palate, where black-fruit and darker-spice flavors reign.
Name: Castelli Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry jam, rose hip and spice aromas are followed by light juicy fruit flavors that finish warm. It doesn't all come together but it still provides enjoyment.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light in color, aromas of caramel and red fruit are followed by light fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem all there, with the variety hard to find.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring strong notes of tire rubber and raspberry. The palate is light in concentration, not able to pull it all together.
Name: Wind Rose 2014 Lonesome Springs Ranch Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy strawberry and red plum meet with sweet cherry-wood smoke and new leather on the nose of this bottling. There is a lot of earthy and spicy depth to the palate, where cinnamon and star anise lift the plump red fruit, all enveloped in chalky tannins and steadily rising acidity.
Name: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 Due Figli Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cranberry and pomegranate juice meet with a hint of dark soil on the nose of this bottling from Camp 4 Vineyard, proving playful but also serious in density. Black plum and açaí rise on the tip of the sip, then the flavors dive into thicker, richer plum paste, chocolate and oregano, surrounded by simmering acidity.
Name: Rideau 2016 The Englishmen Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from the Brunello clone is a great showing of delicacy and balance for a Temecula red wine, starting with tempting aromas of strawberry and hickory smoke. That savory-tinged red-fruit character carries to the palate, which is tense in texture, lifted by peppery spice.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, the aromas are elusive, with notes of raspberry and cherry candy, along with earth accents. The flavors are elegant and pure, lingering on the finish. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should absolutely shine at the dinner table.
Name: Eight Bells 2015 Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of cherry and spice. The palate is plush with fruit flavors, with the tannins giving a (quite) dry squeeze. A warm finish caps it off.
Name: Vino La Monarcha 2015 Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tight blackberry, dried purple flowers and baked earth aromas show on the nose of this Sangiovese that includes 25% Merlot. Somewhat tangy black-plum and violet flavors show on the palate.
Name: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Due Rossi Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Description: Tart, dry acidity accentuates a sharpness of lemon and grapefruit in this thickly textured wine. A gamy note of charcuterie contrasts well against the fruit.
Designation: Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato di
Name: Benessere 2017 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato di Sangiovese (St. Helena)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, coconut, dried cherry and herb lead to a palate that mixes fruit and barrel. It runs a bit hot and the fruit seems dried out.
Name: Barrister 2015 Kiona Estate Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale in color, the aromas offer high-toned notes of raspberry hard candy, cranberry and flower. The palate shows a sense of elegance, with a supple feel to the pure red-fruit flavors.
Name: Lady Hill 2014 Procedo Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Elegant, almost delicate, this complex and inviting wine from a Sangiovese specialist is medium bodied, well balanced and offers mostly subtle flavors that weave nicely through a supple and lightly firm texture. It has dried cherry and cranberry aromas, tangy fruit flavors and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Noceto 2015 Riserva Barrel Select Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a very distinctive, aromatic and enchanting wine that successfully evokes the magic of its Italian relative, Chianti Classico, in the heady mix of black olive, sage, tamarind and new leather aromas followed by tangy, savory, cranberry and tea flavors. The texture is grippy and lightly astringent, while the balance feels perfect.
Name: La Folia Winery 2014 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This light copper-colored wine is crisp, almost steely, light-bodied and refreshing. It is bone dry, extremely appetizing, and offers lean raspberry flavors backed by good acidity.
Name: Monte Volpe 2017 Rosato of Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This excellent wine has tempting aromas of new leather, sandalwood and dried earth, plus complex, savory flavors like dried herbs, prosciutto and green olives complemented by dried cherries. It captures the varietal characteristics very well and avoids being oaky or overly ripe.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Ottimista Vineyards Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather light in the glass, this estate bottling shows cooked red currant and cinnamon spice on the nose. The palate is both lightweight and tannic in texture, showing food-friendly flavors of star anise, clove, fennel and red fruits.
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2015 Illuminatus Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 13% Aglianico, this wine hails from Serra Pedace, Seven Hills, Loess and Mill Creek Upland vineyards. Its light sour cherry, anise, cigar box and spice aromas lead to tart fruit flavors with lightly grainy tannins and a long finish. All about subtlety, it needs food alongside it to fully deliver.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2015 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Few California Sangioveses are this true to type and this affordable. Very smooth, supple and well balanced, this wine is medium bodied, flavorful and will be very versatile with food. Good fruit acidity and light tannins add some grip on the palate, as subtle cherry, sage and leather flavors build toward the finish.
Name: Noceto 2015 Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A deep color and very concentrated fruit flavors make this a bolder than usual Sangiovese. The black-cherry and cranberry flavors are quite ripe, the body is full and the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.
Name: Sassoferrato 2015 Giannecchini Ranch Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Bright pink with a touch of orange tint, this medium-bodied wine has a candy-like nouveau aroma, and fresh, bright cherry and strawberry flavors. It's nothing if not expressive.
Name: V. Sattui 2017 Rosato di Sangiovese (North Coast)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Cranberry, red cherry and fresh oak flavors liven up this medium-bodied, moderately tannic and appetizing wine. It has the nervy texture that the grape variety is known for, and good balance between fruit, acid and body.
Name: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Placer County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from Coyote Canyon Vineyards in the Horse Heaven Hills, this is an unusual offering of the variety. It delivers cranberry, leather, potting soil and herb aromas and light but elegant flavors speckled with spice notes. It doesn't drink nearly as warm as the alcohol might suggest.
Name: Trinity Vineyards 2014 Sangiovese (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Girardet's Bush Vine series explores the winery's recent plantings of Spanish and Italian varieties. From a dry-farmed, high-elevation (800 feet) site, this offers delicate tobacco leaf, plum tomato and strawberry jam flavors. Like many Girardet reds, it has a subtle streak of leather and shows no signs of new oak.
Name: Girardet 2015 Bush Vine Sangiovese (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This pale-colored wine offers pure cherry candy and raspberry aromas. The flavors are light, tart and elegant. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table.
Name: Viola 2015 Dugger Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has a rather shy nose but eventually reveals black plum, underbrush, pressed violet and exotic spice aromas. The full-bodied, enveloping palate offers dried Marasca cherry, brandied prune and star anise flavors framed by fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Dei 2015 Bossona  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Black-skinned berry, forest floor, underbrush and leather lead the nose of this wine. On the juicy, balanced palate, refined tannins support Marasca cherry, raspberry compote and white pepper flavors. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Donna Olga 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Made entirely from organically farmed Sangiovese, this offers inviting baking spice, redcurrant and underbrush aromas. The lively palate delivers raspberry jam, white pepper and tangerine peel touches alongside assertive tannins. Give it a few more years to unwind. Drink 2019–2023.
Name: I Veroni 2014 Quona  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese, this structured red opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, violets, wild berries and dark spice. Firm and full-bodied, the palate doles out dried black cherry, licorice, chopped herb and oak notes framed by taut, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: I Veroni 2015 Quona Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: Made from 100% Sangiovese, this offers underbrush, scorched earth, grilled herb and dark spice aormas. Round and ripe, the full-bodied palate doles out fleshy raspberry, dried black cherry, clove and vanilla flavors. Velvety tannins provide supple support. Drink through 2020.
Name: Cantagallo 2015 Il Fondatore Riserva  (Chianti Montalbano)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this offers forest floor, chopped herb, menthol and mature plum aromas. The savory palate offers prune, dried cherry and star anise flavors alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Villa Travignoli 2016 Governo  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, underbrush and a hint of mint merge together in the glass. The juicy palate doles out red cherry, raspberry jam and a note of eucalyptus, while pliant tannins provide easygoing support. Enjoy soon.
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2016 Al Canapo  (Chianti Colli Senesi)

Description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese grapes with no added sulfites, this earthy red opens with dark-skinned berry, underbrush and thyme aromas. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove and white pepper flavors alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Fattoria Lavacchio 2016 Puro  (Chianti)

Description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese, this offers earthy aromas of red berry, underbrush and scorched soil. The lively palate offers raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper notes alongside supple tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: San Vito 2016  Chianti

Description: This leads with black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and leather aromas. On the juicy palate, firm tannins frame ripe black plum, clove and star anise hints. Enjoy through 2021.
Name: Torre a Cona 2015 Badia a Corte Riserva  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)

Description: Aromas of ripe blackberry, tilled earth and pressed violet come to the forefront. On the juicy, savory palate, supple tannins cushion fleshy black cherry, raspberry jam and star anise. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2015 Fattoria il Colle  (Chianti Superiore)

Description: Made entirely from organically grown Sangiovese, this offers wild berry, forest floor and eucalyptus scents. The savory, enjoyable palate evokes dried black cherries, star anise and white pepper, with polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta San Jacopo 2016 Poggio ai Grilli  (Chianti)

Description: This opens with iris, underbrush and thyme hints. The straightforward, easy-drinking palate offers red cherry, white pepper and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Cantagallo 2016  Chianti Montalbano

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched soil, leather and dark-skinned fruit. The savory, solid palate offers black-skinned berry, tobacco and white pepper flavors alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Casa di Monte 2011  Chianti Montespertoli

Description: This wine's leather, underbrush and dark fruit aromas emerge from the glass. The lively palate delivers blueberry jam, green peppercorn and licorice touches. Drink though 2020.
Name: Malenchini 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Superiore)

Description: Delicate dark fruit and baking spice aromas merge together in this. The straightforward palate delivers juicy black cherry, clove and white pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: San Gervasio 2016  Chianti

Description: Dark-skinned berry, baking spice and leather aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the savory palate, fine-grained tannins support ripe black cherry, licorice and star anise flavors. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Cantagallo 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Montalbano)

Description: Made from 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this suggests dark-skinned fruit, tilled soil and tobacco on the nose. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper notes alongside firm tannins. Drink 2019–2023.
Name: Buccia Nera 2015 Sassocupo  (Chianti Superiore)

Description: This wine's cedar, vanilla and dark-skinned fruit aromas emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dark berry, mocha and star anise flavors alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Cantagallo 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Montalbano)

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and dark fruit lead the nose of this wine. The dense palate offers black plum, clove and white pepper notes alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Parri 2012 Tenuta Cortecciano Urbana  (Chianti Montespertoli)

Description: Earthy aromas of truffle, new leather and underbrush mingle with whiffs of dark-skinned fruit in this wine. The rounded, full-bodied palate offers dried cherry and star anise notes framed in polished tannins.
Name: Badia di Morrona 2014 I Sodi del Paretaio Riserva  (Chianti)

Description: Made entirely from organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with dark-skinned berry and baking spice aromas, with an earthy hint of underbrush. The straightforward, juicy palate offers red plum, clove and cinnamon touches alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Buccia Nera 2016 Guarniente  (Chianti)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with iris, underbrush and Mediterranean herb aromas. The youthful, easygoing palate offers raspberry, white pepper and clove hints alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Titolato Strozzi  (Chianti Colli Senesi)

Description: This wine's underbrush, tilled soil and dark fruit aromas appear in the glass. The straightforward palate offers black plum, clove and white pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Il Colombaio 2016 Contessa Ava  (Chianti)

Description: This opens with toasted oak, mocha and dark berry aromas. The dense palate delivers prune, tobacco and roasted coffee flavors alongside taut, somewhat astringent tannins.
Name: Tenuta Casabianca 2013 Belsedere Riserva  (Chianti Colli Senesi)

Description: This wine's dark fruit, cooking spice and incense aromas emerge from the glass. The lively palate offers sour cherry, citrus zest and star anise notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Rocca di Castagnoli 2016 Villa Montcastello  (Chianti)

Description: Made from 100% Sangiovese, this opens with exotic spice, French oak and black plum aromas that carry over to the taut, tight palate, along with prune and sour cherry notes. Grainy tannins leave a firm, rather astringent finish.
Name: Lornano 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Colli Senesi)

Description: This opens with subdued baking spice and black plum aromas that carry over to the linear palate, along with a hint of clove. It's straightforward and easy-drinking, with smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Parri 2015 Tenuta di Monte  (Chianti)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this has subdued black plum and baking spice aromas. The linear palate delivers prune, clove and licorice hints accompanied by relaxed tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Poggio Nicchiaia 2015 Filetto  (Chianti)

Description: This has subdued aromas of cooking spices and dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate offers black plum and clove alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Tenuta di Trecciano 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Colli Senesi)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this offers violet, thyme and tilled soil aromas. Supple tannins frame its red plum, licorice and baking spice flavors. Enjoy soon.
Name: Buccia Nera 2015 Guarniente  (Chianti)

Description: This informal red has subdued dark fruit and cooking spice aromas. It's easygoing, with red plum and white pepper flavors accompanied by loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2016 La Boncia  (Chianti)

Description: This opens with blue flower and wild berry aromas. The easy-drinking palate delivers crushed raspberry, white pepper and clove hints alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Natale Verga 2016  Chianti

Description: Underbrush, dark fruit and baking spice aromas lead the nose of this wine. The straightforward palate delivers red cherry, clove and orange peel hints alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Pietralta 2016  Chianti

Description: This informal red suggests red fruit and baking spices on the nose. The simple palate offers wild cherry and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Tenuta di Trecciano 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi

Description: This informal red has scorched earth and dark berry scents. The simple palate suggests orange peel, clove and a hint of plum, with easygoing, not very persistent tannins.
Name: Travignoli 2016 Borgo Santa Flora  (Chianti)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Electric pink, the aromas deliver notes of cherry and mint. It drinks off dry, leaning sweeter with cranberry and cherry flavors throughout. It needs a bit more acidity to stand it up.
Name: Maryhill 2017 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, fruit leather and medicine cabinet lead to tart cherry and spice flavors, with the concentration a bit dilute. The variety seems hard to find.
Name: Kestrel 2014 Falcon Series Estate Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: A classic Chianti Classico, this opens with enticing scents of violet, mature plum, new leather and balsamic notes. The aromas follow through to the luminous palate along with dried black cherry, chopped herb, cinnamon and pipe tobacco. Refined tannins provide the backbone while surprisingly fresh acidity for the hot vintage keeps it balanced.
Name: Castell'in Villa 2011  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas like iron, earth and cherries lead to good rich fruit flavors in this well-balanced and medium-bodied wine. Energized by firm tannins and lively acidity, it matches them with ripe cherry and raspberry flavors and a tantalizing spiciness that lasts through the finish.
Name: Noceto 2015 Hillside Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Blue flower, crushed dark-skinned berry, dark culinary spice, new leather and balsamic aromas jump out of the glass on this expressive wine. It's juicy and full bodied, offering black-cherry, blackberry, coconut and star anise flavors offset by polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Ormanni 2012 Etichetta Storica Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: It tastes as if Noceto is getting a better and better handle on this tricky grape variety. This wine captures the tension along with the complexity and generosity of this traditional Tuscan grape. It has intriguing smoke, raspberry and black-pepper aromas, lively cherry and cranberry flavors and good gripping tannins in the texture.
Name: Noceto 2015 Marmellata Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Not many California Sangioveses are this good. It's impressive how a core of great fruit flavor fills up this well-balanced and full-bodied wine from the first whiff to the lingering finish. It starts with cinnamon, nutmeg and black-cherry aromas, brings clove and more cherry on the palate and wraps it all in a texture of velvety tannins.
Name: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black plum, vanilla, eucalyptus and a touch of ginger. The savory, balanced palate doles out ripe black cherry, licorice, white pepper and cedar alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Castello di Gabbiano 2013 Bellezza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Exotic spice, red berry, blue flower and a whiff of French oak aromas emerge in the glass. Youthfully austere, the firmly structured palate delivers raw sour cherry, pomegranate, star anise and powdered sage. Tightly knit fine-grained tannins grip the finish while vibrant acidity lends balance. This will benefit with several more years of aging. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Felsina 2013 Colonia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this has aromas of red-skinned berry, new leather and a whiff of mint. The juicy polished palate doles out fleshy red cherry, cinnamon, clove and a touch of vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: Il Palagio di Panzano 2013  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of eucalyptus. The juicy savory palate delivers Marasca cherry, white pepper and tobacco alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Carobbio 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with enticing aromas of iris, black-skinned berry and Mediterranean herb. The structured, savory palate offers juicy wild cherry, star anise and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Castelvecchi 2013 Madonnino della Pieve Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An aroma like ginger cookies and generous fruit and spice flavors make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Clove, ginger and nutmeg fill the aroma, while black-cherry and black-currant notes coat the palate and linger on the finish. It's a fairly big wine that's delicious and well-balanced.
Name: Noceto 2015 Dos Oakies Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this offers enticing aromas of iris, wild berry and new leather. The bright palate doles out black cherry, white pepper, clove and a touch of thyme alongside fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2024.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2015 Montaperto  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A promising new project out of Temecula, this bottling, which includes 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, offers dense aromas of dried strawberry, red plum, vanilla and baking spice. Cooked cranberry, strawberry and pomegranate flavors show on the sip, which is framed by a chalky texture and lifted by hints of rose and carnation.
Name: Lorimar 2014 Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Description: This wine balances ripe fruit flavors with oak spiciness. Aromas of mahogany and cedar start it off, followed by cherry and black currant flavors that are shaded by chocolate and linger on the finish. It boasts an appetizing and moderately tannic texture, with supportive acidity that keeps it fresh and compelling.
Name: Masthead 2015 Mohr-Fry Ranch Block 433 Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry, forest floor and a whiff of cedar. The structured palate offers dried black cherry, clove, licorice and mocha flavors framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
Designation: Riserva di Fizzano Single Vineyard Gran Selezione
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2014 Riserva di Fizzano Single Vineyard Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this boasts earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The savory palate delivers Marasca cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Castagnoli 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The juicy elegant palate gives red cherry, vanilla and a touch of mint alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Buondonno 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of violet, underbrush and white pepper. The bright savory palate has juicy red cherry, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Castello di Monterinaldi 2015 Vigneto Boscone  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of mulberry, iris and underbrush. The bright juicy palate offers black cherry, black pepper, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, underbrush and baking spice. On the dense palate, velvety tannins support black plum, mocha, vanilla and a hint of tobacco. Drink through 2023.
Name: Il Palagio di Panzano 2011 Le Bambole Gran Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is dense with rounded and deep blackberry at its core. The palate is framed by strong tannins but also bright acidity, which carry forth energetic well-integrated flavors of bursting berry fruit and dark spice.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The purity of fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine is compelling to taste, and shines through in a focused way uncomplicated by noticeable oakiness. The wine is elegant, sleek in texture and redolent of red cherries all the way through a lingering finish.
Name: Noceto 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of iris, sunbaked soil and a balsamic note. The firm palate delivers ripe black cherry, mocha, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink now–2024.
Name: Borgo Scopeto 2012 Misciano Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, tobacco and cedar. The firm savory palate offers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Castello di Meleto 2012  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A spicy cedary minerally aroma leads to bright raspberry and cranberry flavors in this medium-bodied, complex and appetizing wine. It has good acidity and fine-grained tannins to help the grip, and pleasant light flavors that will be great at the table.
Name: Noceto 2011 AX1 Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Released each year around Valentine's Day, this carbonic experiment was an immediate hit. Served with a chill and very light in the glass, it shows primary aromas of strawberry, cola and rosewater. The playful palate is zippy with acid and dances across the tongue with flavors of tart red fruit. A great sunny day wine, but buy multiple bottles because they go fast.
Name: Stolpman 2017 Love You Bunches Carbonic Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, tobacco and new leather. The enticing palate doles out dried black cherry, clove and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Fattoria San Michele a Torri 2013 Tenuta La Gabbiola Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A beefy brothy aroma leads to rich concentrated fruit flavors in this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. It has good structure, tasty layers of black cherry and red cherry and a mouth-filling presence that's appealing.
Name: Noceto 2015 Misto Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this evokes delicate aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The chewy palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and espresso alongside firm but fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta di Capraia 2013 Effe 55 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of iris, moist soil and tobacco. The medium-bodied palate shows juicy black cherry, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins.
Name: Fattoria Poggerino 2014  Chianti Classico

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled earth, game and black-skinned fruit. The ripe forward palate offers black plum, star anise and sweet tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Il Palagio di Panzano 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A lot of ripeness and plenty of warm spicy oaky accents make this wine both mouth filling and easy to dive into. There are vanilla, cinnamon and sandalwood scents in the aromas, and fully ripe plum flavors along with light tannins.
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil and black-skinned berry mingle with a whiff of vanilla. The straightforward palate delivers mature Morello cherry, licorice and cinnamon alongside supple tannins.
Name: Casa di Monte 2011 Le Capitozze Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, incense and a whiff of underbrush. The rounded palate delivers dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Fattoria Il Colombaio 2015 Gaspero  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with black cherry, leather and cedar aromas. The concentrated palate delivers black plum, espresso and tobacco alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2012 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and aromatic herb mingle together on this. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, clove and black pepper while velvety tannins provide a smooth framework. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Rignana 2013 Villa di Rignana  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and cooking spice lead the nose. The bright palate offers black cherry, licorice and a touch of mocha alongside round tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2015 Tenuta Sant'Alfonso  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas of black-skinned berry and cedar lift out of the glass. The firm medium-bodied palate offers ripe black cherry, vanilla and licorice alongside assertive, tightly knit tannins. Drink 2018–2023.
Name: Rocca di Castagnoli 2013 Stielle Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, cooking spice and a touch of iris aromas unfold in the glass. The concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, licorice, tobacco and a hint of mocha alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Cantalici L'Antica Fornace di Ridolfo 2013 Baruffo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, tobacco leaf and dark-skinned fruit while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and licorice. Smooth tannins offer subtle support.
Name: Casa di Monte 2011 Le Capitozze Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas of violet, underbrush and leather come together on this. The firm palate delivers dried black cherry, vanilla and cinnamon alongside closed-grained tannins.
Name: Tenuta di Capraia 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and baking spice. The bright palate delivers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2015 Dofana  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Delicate aromas of baking spice, black-skinned berry and tobacco lift out of the glass. The straightforward enjoyable palate offers dried black cherry, vanilla and cinnamon alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Tolaini 2015 Vallenuova  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas suggesting stewed prune, underbrush, Asian spice, French oak and tobacco leaf slowly take shape. The taut tightly wound palate shows dried cherry, raw cranberry, dried sage and clove. Assertive, grainy tannins leave a somewhat lean, astringent finish.
Name: Felsina 2011 Colonia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, truffle and black plum. The medium-bodied palate presents dried black cherry, tobacco and a hint of orange peel alongside round tannins.
Name: Fietri 2012 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas of cedar, underbrush and a touch of black-skinned fruit lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers clove, cinnamon and black plum alongside closed-grained tannins.
Name: Villa a Sesta 2013 Sorleone Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, tobacco and blue flower take center stage. The easygoing palate shows juicy Marasca cherry, cinnamon and a touch of star anise alongside lithe tannins.
Name: Castello di Meleto 2015 Meleto  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This offers aromas reminiscent of cedar, black-skinned fruit and a subtle whiff of oak. The firm palate doles out dried black cherry, vanilla and a mocha note set against taut assertive tannins.
Name: Castelvecchi 2014 Lodolaio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is very generous in aromas and flavors, offering ample spicy, cedary, and sunbaked aromas and a spiciness on the palate that's almost sweet, backed by ripe poached fruit flavors and accents of maple syrup. Firm tannins and a good touch of acidity keep it balanced.
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2014 Landmark Collection Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned berry, coffee bean and underbrush. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Triacca 2014 La Madonnina Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has an alluring oak aroma, rich, spicy and oaky flavors and a mouth-filling texture due to full body and pretty strong tannins. The woody notes of cedar, tobacco, chocolate and cinnamon take center stage while fruit flavors play a secondary role.
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2014 Riserva Collection Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward palate evokes black cherry, clove and star anise alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Triacca 2014 La Madonnina Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and a whiff of bay leaf. The no-frills palate suggests black cherry, sage and a hint of vanilla set against assertive tannins.
Name: Buondonno 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward palate offers clove, licorice and black-cherry jam alongside round tannins.
Name: Villa a Sesta 2014 Il Palei  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong earthy swath of wet clay and mud on the nose of this bottling along with dried cranberry and carnation petals. The palate is lacking a bit in acid and tannins, but the mellow flavors of light cranberry, pomegranate and gravel are quaffable.
Name: Harmony Cellars 2015 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy, herbal aromas and a considerable amount of oak flavor drives this full-bodied, relatively soft-textured wine. It has black-plum and raisin notes on the palate and a broad mouthfeel.
Name: Fenestra 2015 Sangiovese (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this pops with cherry Jolly Rancher, herb and spice aromas. The flavors are light and elegant but lack concentration. It doesn't stand up on its own but has a place at the dinner table.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with aromas of red plum, vanilla and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate together with round tannins.
Name: Casalino 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has subdued aromas of ripe raspberry, resin and a whiff of baking spice. The simple light-bodied palate suggests black cherry and a hint of clove alongside mellow, rather fleeting tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Casalino 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Quite tannic and acidic, too, this wine smells chocolaty, tastes like tart strawberries and feels chunky and astringent on the palate. It needs something rich, like lasagna, for a good pairing.
Name: Suveg 2014 Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: Enticing aromas of ripe berry, chopped herb, new leather, tobacco and a whiff of eucalyptus all mingle together on this gorgeous, vibrant red. The stunning, savory palate boasts juicy red cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and star anise while firm refined tannins and vibrant acidity lend structure and balance. It's already extraordinary and elegant but also young and primary, so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Altesino 2013 Montosoli  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Captivating scents of pressed violet, dark spice, perfumed berry, new leather and balsamic eucalyptus notes reveal the wine's elegance and pedigree even before the first sip. The full-bodied palate boasts remarkable finesse and a weightless intensity, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, tobacco and licorice. It's impeccably balanced, with firm polished tannins and fresh acidity. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2036.
Name: Le Potazzine 2011 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Delicate aromas of new leather, wild berry, chopped mint and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus come together on this stunning wine. The palate is still youthfully restrained, but already offers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a hint of truffle set against tightly wound, refined tannins. Bright acidity provides balance. It needs time to unwind and fully develop but promises to blossom into a stunner. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Salvioni 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Truffle, underbrush, new leather, wild berry and violet aromas are front and center on this gorgeous, full-bodied red. The taut, vibrant palate combines power and grace, delivering crushed red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and tobacco. It's young but impeccably balanced, with firm noble tannins and bright acidity. Hold to give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Baricci 2013  Brunello di Montalcino
