Description: Subdued aromas of dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and leather lead the way. The solid, no-frills palate delivers black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink from 2022 through 2027.
Name: Il Valentiano 2013 Campaperi  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas evoking black-skinned berry, underbrush and baking spice. The straightforward palate offers Morello cherry, clove and star anise alongside taut tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Il Valentiano 2013 Campo di Marzo  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, underbrush and a touch of cedar. The solid straightforward palate offers black cherry and star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Aromas of cedar, espresso and prune lead the nose. The firm palate offers licorice, black cherry jam and a touch of mocha alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: La Fornace 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Initially shy, this eventually reveals black-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas. The rounded palate offers raspberry jam, vanilla and star anise alongside smooth tannins. It's rather straightforward for Brunello. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: La Palazzetta 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals delicate aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The firm palate offers raw plum, vanilla and clove alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: La Togata 2013 Jacopus  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Aromas of dark fruit, leather and underbrush emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate presents prune, mocha and a hint of star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Podere La Vigna 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with aromas of tilled soil and dark berry. The solid straightforward palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and a hint of mocha alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Vini Italiani da Sogno 2013 Carillon  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, leather and a hint of black plum lift out of the glass. The solid tightly packed palate offers prune, vanilla and clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Fattoria La Lecciaia 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: The nose is shy but eventually gives up suggestions of coffee, balsamic notes and a whiff of pressed violet. The tightly wound palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Madonna Nera 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with subtle plum, tobacco and baking-spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers black cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Pietranera 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting red plum, tilled soil and green peppercorn. The straightforward, already approachable palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and a touch of nutmeg alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: La Collina dei Lecci 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Aromas of vanilla, black plum and balsamic notes lead the nose. The dense palate offers licorice, spiced plum and pipe tobacco alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: La Rasina 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of cedar, black plum and underbrush. The dense firmly structured palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Renieri 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This solid red has subdued aromas of dark fruit, baking spice and leather. The straightforward palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Tamburini 2013 Somnio  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit and baking spice emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate shows black plum, clove and pepper alongside round tannins. It's already hitting its ideal drinking window so enjoy soon.
Name: Voliero 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with subdued aromas that evoke slightly weedy underbrush, star anise and a hint of dark berry. The no-frills palate offers Marasca cherry, vanilla and a hint of clove alongside relaxed tannins.
Name: Castellani 2013 Borgobruno  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Here's an easygoing Sangiovese that has aromas of black-skinned berry and baking spice. The fruity straightforward palate offers red cherry, raspberry jam and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Titolato Strozzi  (Morellino di Scansano)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of charred underbrush, leather and a balsamic note. Reflecting the heat of the vintage, the fruit is already drying up, offering dried cherry and powdered sage alongside grainy tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Podere San Giacomo 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of cedar, oak-driven spice and a whiff of dark fruit. The grainy palate offers plum, sage and espresso alongside close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Albatreti 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Subdued aromas of culinary spice and dark fruit emerge from the glass. It's rather light-bodied for Brunello, offering Marasca cherry and a touch of vanilla alongside loose-knit tannins.
Name: Bonacchi 2013 Casalino  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with aromas of prune, vanilla and a suggestion of cedar. The straightforward palate offers black-cherry extract, star anise and clove alongside rounded tannins. It's evolving quickly so drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit sensations.
Name: Poggio il Castellare 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with aromas of leather, underbrush and a hint of blackberry. The round straightforward palate offers black-plum and tobacco flavors alongside smooth tannins. It's already accessible so drink soon.
Name: Poggio Nardone 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cranberry, cherry and barrel spice lead to plentiful cran-raspberry flavors that show some warmth on the finish. It's an enjoyable example of the variety.
Name: Twin Cedars 2015 Sangiovese (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: This offers subtle aromas of black plum and cedar while the evolved palate evokes dried blackberry, chewing tobacco and vanilla. Ripe, firm tannins provide support. Drink after 2022.
Name: Brunelli Martoccia 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, coconut and roasted coffee bean emerge from the glass. The dense, brawny palate offers blackcurrant jam, espresso and licorice alongside firm but rather evolved tannins. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak and you'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol that throws it off balance.
Name: Fanti 2012 Vigna Le Macchiarelle Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This wine shows subdued aromas suggesting prune and a whiff of dark spice. The tightly packed palate shows clove, dried blackberry and tobacco leaf alongside assertive, astringent tannins that clamp down on the finish. Give the tannins several years to unclench then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Il Poggiolo 2012 Beato Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark fruit, baking spice and a hint of mocha. The firm no-frills palate offers clove, black currant jam and vanilla alongside assertive close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Mocali 2013 Vigna delle Raunate  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of pomegranate, fruit punch and carnation show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite fruity all around. The palate offers candied red plums and rosewater flavors, set against a sticky tannic structure.
Name: Montemar Wines 2014 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Ballard Canyon)

Description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, leather and a whiff of black-skinned berry. The forward palate shows blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside rounded tannins.
Name: Sensi 2012 Boscoselvo  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Subdued aromas of mature plum and Mediterranean scrub emerge from the glass. It's extremely straightforward and already almost approachable, evoking Morello cherry and a hint of star anise alongside taut, not very persistent tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Vini Italiani da Sogno 2013 Notte di Note  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas come off as a bit dried out, with notes of fruit leather, dried raspberry and spice. The cranberry flavors seem a bit clipped.
Name: Covington 2014 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and grilled sage emerge from the glass. The dense palate shows cherry marinated in spirits, mocha and clove framed in taut, close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Il Paradiso di Frassina 2012 Flauto Magico Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with dark berry, baking spice and eucalyptus aromas that carry over to the robust, no-frills palate together with some clove. Close-grained tannins provide assertive support.
Name: Podere La Vigna 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of plum and underbrush that carry over to the straightforward palate alongside a touch of white pepper. Smooth tannins lend easygoing support.
Name: Bonacchi 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Subdued of aromas of dark cherry, baking spice and underbrush segue over to the lean palate together with a white-pepper note. Round, not very persistent tannins lead to a rather short finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bonacchi 2013 Molino del Piano  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This offers aromas of plum, tangerine peel and a hint of hay. The no-frills palate offers prune, vanilla and star anise alongside firm tannins that lead to a rather abrupt finish. Drink after 2021.
Name: Canneta 2013 Le Bruciate  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Subtle aromas of black fruit, tilled soil and white pepper lead the nose. The simple palate offers plum, vanilla and nutmeg alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Castellani 2013 Famiglia Castellani  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Coffee, dark berry and baking spice aromas lead the nose. The dense palate evokes tobacco, prune and a touch of bitter almond alongside firm, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Fattoria La Lecciaia 2012 Manapetra Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with restrained aromas of old leather, underbrush and a hint of mature dark fruit. The densely packed palate offers black cherry jam, clove and star anise alongside aggressive, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: La Collina dei Lecci 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals baking spice, vanilla and balsamic notes. The firm palate suggests espresso, toasted oak and Marasca cherry alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: La Fornace 2013 Origini  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, leather, game and a whiff of dark berry lead the way. It's straightforward and compact, offering black cherry jam, clove and tobacco alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Mocali 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Licorice, hoisin plum sauce and stewed strawberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Temecula area. Baked licorice, charred meat and roasted red plums show on the sip, where decent acidity and squeaky tannins provide structure.
Name: Orange Coast WInery 2015 Sangiovese (California)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals whiffs of baking spice and black plum. The straightforward palate offers blackberry jam and star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Rodolfo Cosimi 2012 Terra Rossa Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: This opens with aromas of mature plum, vanilla and mocha. The solid palate delivers prune, espresso and coconut alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Verbena 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting prune and a whiff of dark spice. The tightly compacted palate shows clove, dried blackberry and tobacco leaf alongside assertive, astringent tannins that clamp down on the finish. Give the tannins several years to unclench then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Il Poggiolo 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas of tilled soil, clove and dark fruit. The simple palate offers prune and vanilla alongside easygoing tannins. It has a rather fleeting finish.
Name: Uggiano 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, aromas of spice and cherry lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. It all seems a bit faint.
Name: Cerulean 2013 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this full-bodied red opens with aromas of wild berry, exotic spice, aromatic herb and a whiff  of fragrant blue flower. It's elegant and structured, with a youthful tension that underscores juicy wild cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and a hint of pipe tobacco. Fresh acidity lends balance while fine-grained tannins provide polished support. It's already tempting but will develop even more complexity with cellaring. Drink 2018–2033.
Name: Boscarelli 2013 Il Nocio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Blue flower, Asian spice and wild berry aromas mingle with a whiff of espresso. The rounded generous palate offers baked plum, fleshy blackberry, licorice and a hint of mocha alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Poggio alla Sala 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of oak, coconut, forest floor and plum cake that carry over to the chewy palate along with juicy black cherry, mocha and vanilla. Soft rounded tannins provide supple support.
Name: La Braccesca 2013 Vigneto Santa Pia Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine offers aromas of scorched earth, pipe tobacco, mature black-skinned berry and a hint of leather. The rounded, generous palate doles out juicy black cherry, fleshy raspberry, star anise and a hint of cinnamon alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Trerose 2015 Santa Caterina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Pressed iris, plum cake and camphor aromas take center stage on this approachable red. The round chewy palate offers fleshy black cherry, blackberry jam and cinnamon alongside relaxed smooth tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the juicy fruit.
Name: Il Macchione 2011 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Blue flower, plum cake and baking spice aromas come to the forefront while a whiff of tilled earth lingers in the background. The elegant firmly structured palate shows raspberry preserves, star anise and espresso set against taut, polished tannins. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Antico Colle 2013 Il Saggio Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This offers classic Sangiovese aromas of wild cherry, tilled soil, blue flower, pipe tobacco and a whiff of truffle. The aromas flow over seamlessly to the polished palate along with a hint of licorice. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, it's more delicately structured than usual but is a fantastic effort. Drink through 2020.
Name: Lunadoro 2014 Pagliareto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, pipe tobacco, toasted oak and a whiff of baked plum appear in the forefront. The tightly wound palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and grilled herb framed in austere close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to relax then drink to catch the fruit richness.
Name: Carpineto 2010 Vigneto Poggio Sant'Enrico  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Pipe tobacco, wild berry and star anise aromas set the tone on this light-bodied but savory red. The bright, almost ethereal palate reflects the nose, offering Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of graphite framed in polished tannins.
Name: Salcheto 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Underbrush, chopped herb, baked plum and a whiff of new leather aromas take shape in the glass. The taut dense palate offers prune, blackberry extract and licorice framed in tightly knit close-grained tannins that give the finish a grip.
Name: Talosa 2013 Filai Lunghi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe plum, cake spice and menthol make their way to the forefront. On the full-bodied palate, taut fine-grained tannins support dried black cherry, prune and mocha. Fresh acidity lifts the brooding flavors.
Name: Talosa 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Dark-skinned berry, forest floor, new oak and exotic spice aromas are front and center. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, cranberry, oak, vanilla and coconut framed in tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Avignonesi 2013 Grandi Annate  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this lively medium-bodied red opens with aromas of new leather, red plum and a whiff of peppercorn. The bright palate offers tart red cherry, white pepper and a hint of pomegranate alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari 2014 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Wild berry, tilled soil, violet and cake spice aromas lift out of the glass along with an earthy whiff of new leather. The fresh, youthfully austere palate delivers red cherry, tangy cranberry, ground clove and crushed herb framed in fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Nottola 2013 Origine Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Here's a 100% Sangiovese that offers aromas of blueberry, violet and a hint of thyme. The lively palate evokes red cherry, cinnamon and a balsamic note alongside smooth tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.
Name: Rocca di Montemassi 2016 Le Focaie  (Maremma Toscana)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese has aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and white pepper. It's bright and fresh, with crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and clove. Polished tannins provide lithe support.
Name: Fattoria di Magliano 2014 Sinarra  (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb, dark culinary spice and a whiff of violet. On the sleek light-bodied palate, polished tannins and fresh acidity underscore Marasca cherry, raspberry and clove. Drink through 2021.
Name: Avignonesi 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: This 100% Sangiovese opens with iris, raspberry and Mediterranean scrub aromas. The easygoing palate offers red cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Pepi Lignana 2014 Cerida  (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy fruits of pomegranate, strawberry and orange rind meet with dried ginger and Christmas spice on the nose of this bottling. It's light and easy on the palate, sailing through with bright red fruits and hints of herbs.
Name: Di Bruno 2013 Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Toast, underbrush, licorice and charred-earth aromas carry over to the palate along with prune, blackberry extract, coconut and a confectionary note. Dusty tannins give it a rather grainy finish.
Name: Salcheto 2012 Salco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, toast, oak and espresso take the forefront. On the approachable palate, close-grained tannins give flexible support to fleshy black cherry, mature plum, coffee and nutmeg. Enjoy soon to capture the remaining freshness and fruit.
Name: Poggio alla Sala 2013 Parceto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of moist soil, underbrush, leather and a whiff of eucalyptus take shape on this. Taut and racy, the linear palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, powdered sage and a hint of clove set against vibrant acidity. Tight, rather grainy tannins grip the close.
Name: Le Bèrne 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Underbrush, violet, aromatic herb and wild berry aromas appear at the forefront. The light-bodied palate is less expressive, showing dried blackberry and clove alongside dusty tannins.
Name: Fattoria Del Cerro 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a beefy wine with interesting components that suggest dried blood, compost, black cherry and cola. It's front loaded and flavorful, but turns a bit stemmy and tannic through the finish.
Name: Ledger David 2014 Sangiovese (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of stewed prune and toasted notes lead the nose on this brawny red. Searing alcohol dominates the palate and throws it off balance while blackberry extract, licorice and toasted oak notes linger in the background. Grainy tannins give it an astringent finish.
Name: Valdipiatta 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Always one of the benchmarks for Sangiovese, the 2013 doesn't disappoint. It boasts alluring scents of blue flower, perfumed berry, exotic spice and a whiff of French oak that flow over to the vibrant, elegant palate along with wild cherry, raspberry compote and licorice. Bright acidity and taut, fine-grained tannins provide an age-worthy framework. Give it time to develop to its maximum potential. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Isole e Olena 2013 Cepparello Sangiovese (Toscana)

Appellation: Colli della Toscana Centrale, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Balancing structure and finesse, this full-bodied red delivers aromas and flavors of black-skinned berry, licorice, exotic spice and raspberry compote. Tightly knit, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide the age-worthy backbone. Drink 2020–2024. Cellar Selection.
Name: Fontodi 2014 Flaccianello della Pieve Sangiovese (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

Description: Quintessential Sangiovese aromas of pressed violet, wild berry, new leather and dark culinary spice pave the way on this delicious wine. Tight and structured, the elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, licorice and truffle. Bright acidity and assertive, refined tannins provide energy and compelling tension. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Istine 2015 Vigna Casanova dell'Aia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Pressed iris, red-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of rosemary lead the nose on this 100% Sangiovese. The supple, juicy palate delivers black cherry, white pepper, leather and star anise alongside velvety, polished tannins. It's already accessible but will also age well for the next several years or more. Drink through 2025.
Name: Capannelle 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berries, scorched earth, exotic spices, menthol and a whiff of oak are just some of the scents you'll find in this vibrant red. The elegant palate delivers mature Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2012 Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Iris, violet, perfumed berry, pine forest and aromatic herb aromas come into play on this fragrant red. The fresh, savory palate offers juicy Morello cherry, ripe blackberry, clove and star anise set against precise tannins and fresh acidity. It's well balanced and youthfully taut but will be even better in another few years. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Istine 2015 Vigna Istine  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Alluring aromas of wild berry, fragrant purple flower, new leather, dark culinary spice and chopped herb emerge on this classically crafted red. The vibrant, youthfully austere palate offers ripe red cherry, cranberry, tobacco and clove framed in bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Cafaggio 2013 Basilica Solatio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Exotic spice, toast, crushed mint, French oak and black-skinned berry aromas follow over to the linear, elegant palate along with wild cherry and licorice. It's youthfully austere but well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2019–2033.
Name: Volpaia 2013 Il Puro Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of truffle, mocha, scorched earth, toast and baked plum slowly take shape in the glass. Succulent and smooth, the generous, polished palate doles out fleshy black cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon, crushed mint and licorice framed in velvety tannins. It's already delicious and accessible but still offers good mid-term aging. Drink through 2023.
Name: Casa Emma 2011 Fiorella Lepri Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Inviting aromas of wild berry, violet and sandalwood are front and center. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, it's bright, savory and linear, offering Morello cherry, black raspberry and baking spice framed in vibrant acidity and refined tannins. A fantastic showing and unusually expressive for the cool, wet vintage.
Name: Volpaia 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this offers aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The vibrant, elegant palate delivers succulent red cherry, licorice, clove and aromatic herb alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018–2027.
Designation: Vigna Grospoli Antico Lamole Gran Selezione
Name: Fattoria di Lamole 2013 Vigna Grospoli Antico Lamole Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Spiced plum, pressed violet, exotic spice and saddle leather aromas take center stage. Elegant and structured, the vibrant, assertive palate offers black cherry, tobacco and a hint of licorice while racy acidity and fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's youthfully austere and will benefit from more cellaring. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Istine 2014 Levigne Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this elegantly structured red offers enticing aromas of woodland berry, exotic spice and wild herb. Vibrant and savory, the medium-bodied, youthfully austere palate boasts tart cherry, wild raspberry, clove and licorice supported by bright acidity and taut, refined tannins. It's already tempting but will be even better in a few years. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Fontodi 2014  Chianti Classico

Description: Made with Sangiovese hailing from high-altitude vineyards, this lithe red offers classic varietal aromas of wild cherry, violet, new leather, tobacco and a slightly balsamic note of camphor. It's radiant—almost ethereal—with red cherry, strawberry, star anise and white pepper. Vibrant acidity and taut, refined tannins offset the savory flavors. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Fontodi 2014 Filetta di Lamole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This fragrant red offers heady scents of ripe dark-skinned berry, pressed violet, eucalyptus and a potpourri of culinary spice. The refined palate is initially understated but then sneaks up on you with ripe wild cherry, cranberry, licorice and clove. It's surprisingly fresh for such a hot, dry vintage and balanced, with firm, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Monte Bernardi 2015 Retromarcia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas of exotic spice, crushed herb and wild berry slowly unfold in the glass. The austere, medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and star anise set against bright acidity and tightly knit, close-grained tannins. It needs time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: Castello di Radda 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, new leather and eucalyptus. The concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, blackberry jam, tobacco and licorice alongside brooding tannins. Drink 2018–2027.
Name: Tenuta di Lilliano 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Earthy aromas of sunbaked soil, new leather, overripe plum and a whiff of game come together on this. The chewy, savory palate doles out fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise framed in lithe tannins. It's already hit its ideal drinking window so enjoy soon.
Name: Querceto di Castellina 2015 L'Aura  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Truffle, tilled earth, exotic spice and woodland berry aromas emerge in the glass along with a toasted note. It's racy and firmly structured, offering tart red cherry, cranberry, coffee bean and clove set against tightly drawn, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Castello d'Albola 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Lovely scents of forest berry, new leather, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of pipe tobacco take shape in the glass. It's racy and elegant, offering crushed strawberry, red cherry and star anise set against a backbone of firm acidity and taut, refined tannins. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Eredi Enzo Raspi 2014 Bandini Villa Pomona  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: Cecchi 2015 Valore di Famiglia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of French oak, exotic spice and black-skinned berry take center stage. Fresh and linear, the palate offers cassis, cranberry and crushed raspberry framed in fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Casa Emma 2013 Vignalaparco  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of underbrush, cedar and black-skinned berry. The chewy palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice, black pepper and coffee alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy now through 2024.
Name: Lornano 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of dark culinary spice, mature berry and a whiff of new leather emerge in the glass. The tightly wound, tense palate offers wild cherry, licorice and clove framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Give this another year or two at least to fully develop. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Felsina 2015 Berardenga Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of cooking spice, leather and a whiff of violet. The firm palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove and licorice set against closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Terra di Seta 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: The subtle nose of this 100% Sangiovese suggests aromas of tilled earth, baking spice and black-skinned berry. The linear palate offers black cherry, licorice, clove and a hint of ripe raspberry alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy though 2025.
Name: Colle Bereto 2013 Il Convento Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, baked plum and pipe tobacco aromas slowly take shape. The palate offers dried cherry, prune, star anise and crushed sage while firm acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins provide the austere backbone. Give this a few more years for the tannins to unwind. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Il Molino di Grace 2013 Il Margone Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor, eucalyptus and dried herb mingle with whiffs of blue flower and ripe plum. The taut, juicy palate delivers fleshy Marasca cherry, black raspberry and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Istine 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this bright red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and eucalyptus. The savory, easygoing palate doles out tart cherry, star anise with a hint of citrus zest alongside fresh acidity and limber tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Bibbiano 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Crushed mint, dried red berry, underbrush and new leather aromas lift out of the glass. The lithe, straightforward palate offers dried cherry, grilled herb and a white pepper note set against polished tannins. Vibrant acidity lends balance.
Name: Cafaggio 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese shows varietal aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and a whiff of leather. The tight, savory palate delivers tobacco, white pepper and Morello cherry set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: Capannelle 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This delicious, easygoing red boasts typical Sangiovese aromas of wild berry, crushed violet and a whiff dark spice. The juicy, enjoyable palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, fleshy plum and cake spice while supple tannins provide smooth support. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Badia a Coltibuono 2015 RS  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Moist underbrush, toasted oak and a whiff of camphor lead the nose. The linear, mid-weight palate shows juicy black cherry, licorice and other oak-driven spices framed in vibrant firm acidity while austere, fine-grained tannins grip the finish. Give it a few more years to mellow and fully come together.
Name: Casa Sola 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has classic varietal aromas of red cherry, leather and a touch of violet. The savory palate offers ripe raspberry, licorice and clove while polished tannins and fresh acidity provide balance and structure. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: Poggio al Sole 2014 Casasilia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, baked plum and leather. The dense, solid palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and a touch of star anise alongside smooth, seasoned tannins. Enjoy through 2023.
Name: Fattoria di Lamole 2011 Le Stinche Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: New leather, dark spice, truffle and fleshy plum aromas take center stage. On the well-structured palate, close-knit, polished tannins support mature black cherry, clove and star anise. Drink through 2020.
Name: Cafaggio 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of French oak, baked plum, espresso and a whiff of vanilla carry over to the smooth palate together with ripe cherry and a hint of star anise. Fine-grained tannins offer polished support.
Name: Castello di Radda 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with truffle, black-skinned berry and leather aromas. Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, the juicy, medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper while polished tannins give it balance and support. Enjoy through 2023.
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2014 Vigna Bastignano  (Chianti Classico)

Description: New leather, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of violet are all classic Sangiovese aromas. It's ripe but bright, offering mature wild cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside compact tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Eredi Enzo Raspi 2015 Bandini Villa Pomona  (Chianti Classico)

Description: French oak, spiced plum, coconut and blue flower aromas lead the nose. On the palate, fine-grained tannins underscore oak-driven spice, prune, vanilla and dried black cherry. Drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2013 Mocenni Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Toast, French oak, espresso and forest floor aromas lead the nose. The tight palate is assertively tannic, offering cassis, dried cherry, coconut and vanilla alongside astringent, close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Fattoria di Corsignano 2013 L'Imperatrice Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with scents reminiscent of ripe plum, dark culinary spice, balsamic notes and a whiff of espresso. The austere palate is vibrant but a bit lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, licorice and coffee bean framed in bright acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give it a few more years to come around then drink.
Name: Ormanni 2013 Borro del Diavolo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of French oak, vanilla, coconut and black-skinned fruit. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with dried black cherry, blackberry and star anise. Assertive, close-grained leave an astringent finish.
Name: Casa Emma 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Scorched earth, Asian spice and stewed prune aromas combine with a whiff of camphor. The tight palate offers dried cherry, star anise and espresso alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2012 Clemente VII Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of tobacco leaf, black-skinned berry and an earthy whiff of truffle. The structured palate delivers black plum, clove and a touch of cinnamon alongside pliant tannins.
Name: Fietri 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has subdued aromas of baking spice, meat juice and black-skinned fruit. The firm palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and clove alongside tightly knit tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Colle Bereto 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas suggesting black cherry, game and underbrush take the lead while the juicy palate offers raspberry jam, clove and star anise. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2023.
Name: Fattoria di Lamole 2013 Le Stinche  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Here's a 100% Sangiovese that opens with aromas of woodland berry, underbrush and a hint of balsamic herb. The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Lornano 2013  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, vanilla and underbrush waft out of the glass. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the concentrated palate doles out ripe black plum, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside closed-grained tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bibbiano 2013 Vigna del Capannino  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe black cherry, plum, crushed mint and a whiff of baking spice carry over to the to the juicy palate along with a hint of licorice. It's savory and easygoing, with dusty tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Campomaggio 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red plum, cedar and espresso while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, toast and licorice. Closed-grained, rather astringent tannins provide the setting.
Name: Le Bocce 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas reminiscent of camphor, new leather and exotic spice lead the nose. The tightly wound palate, brooding palate offers dried black cherry and clove set against close-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Felsina 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of mature plum, pressed violet, new leather and ground clove lift out of the glass. The ripe, dense palate shows fleshy wild cherry, blackberry jam, star anise and the heat of evident alcohol. Close-grained tannins offer support.
Name: L'Antica Fornace di Ridolfo 2015 Baruffo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese offers aromas that recall black plum, tilled soil and tobacco. The dense palate evokes black cherry jam, mocha and licorice alongside tightly drawn tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Machiavelli 2013 Vigna di Fontalle Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: French oak, cassis, chopped herb aromas and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. It's taut and full-bodied palate but rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering prune, licorice, dried sage and espresso while clenching, close-grained tannins leave an astringent finish.
Name: Felsina 2013 Rancia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, black plum, espresso and a whiff of dark culinary spice lead the nose. The aromas carry on to the austere palate along with dried cherry, coconut and star anise. Hints of powdered sage and tightly drawn, close-grained tannins give it an astringent close.
Name: Bibbiano 2014 Vigne di Montornello Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, ripe plum and underbrush lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried Morello cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2015 Clemente VII  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Mocha, cedar and blackberry aromas lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers licorice, tobacco and black cherry jam alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: A very pretty pale peach color, the aromas display intriguing notes of tangerine peel, herb, flint, strawberry, flower and mineral. It drinks dry and is elegant in style, with plentiful tangerine flavors on the finish. It's shows some sneaky complexity.
Name: Vino 2016 Rosé Sangiovese (Washington)

Description: Made with 100% Sangiovese, this fragrant red has alluring aromas of wild berry, crushed herb, blue flower and cake spice. It's straightforward but savory, with juicy red cherry, cinnamon and star anise framed in bright acidity and easygoing tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Cafaggio 2016 Single Estate  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese offers aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and tilled soil. The straightforward palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and mocha alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta degli Dei 2015 Forcole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting prune and star anise. The aromas carry over to palate along with a hint of wild raspberry, chopped herb and bright acidity. It's already approachable, with dusty tannins that provide loose support. Drink through 2019.
Name: Fattoria Poggerino 2014 Bugialla Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This 100% Sangiovese offers aromas of black plum, espresso and cedar. The straightforward, ripe palate delivers blackberry, vanilla and a licorice note framed in firm tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2015 La Ghirlanda  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are a bit unusual, with notes of wood spice and raspberry fruit leather, not seeming entirely harmonious. The palate is quite light in style, painting around the edges. It's interesting but it doesn't all come together—not standing on its own.
Name: Plumb Cellars 2013 Estate JK Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese grapes, this has subdued aromas suggesting baking spice and black plum. The concentrated palate offers vanilla, espresso, prune and clove alongside assertive tannins that lead to a mouth-drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Terra di Seta 2012 Assai Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas suggesting scorched earth, woodshop and grilled herb carry over to the evolved palate along with roasted coffee bean, coconut and a hint of prune. Close-grained tannins provide support. There's not much fruit left so drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2012 Clemente VII Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of mocha, coconut and red plum lead the nose. The dense palate delivers raisin, vanilla and toasted oak alongside close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Fattoria Le Fonti 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This shows earthy aromas of truffle, tilled soil and a whiff of ripe plum. The bright palate offers raspberry jam, cinnamon and a hint or orange peel alongside round tannins.
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2015 Cappone  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Scorched earth, pressed violet, clove and a whiff of black-skinned berry delicately lead the nose. The palate is rather evolved, offering prune, orange rind and a hint of star anise framed in loose, dusty tannins that leave a drying, somewhat fleeting finish. Drink soon.
Name: Cantalici L'Antica Fornace di Ridolfo 2012 Messer Ridolfo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has restrained aromas of baking spice, cedar and black plum. The firm palate offers black cherry jam, licorice and mocha alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins.
Name: Casale dello Sparviero 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Stewed prune, moist soil, pressed blue flower and dried herb aromas combine with a balsamic note. The dense palate offers dried cherry, orange slice, licorice and espresso framed in close-grained not very persistent tannins that lead to a rather abrupt, drying finish.
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2013 Lamole Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Wild berry, new leather and dark spice aromas blend together with a whiff of blue flower. The austere, lean palate shows dried cherry, orange slice and a hint of ground clove. Assertive, grainy tannins create a bracing, mouth-drying finish.
Name: Orsumella 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of moist soil, new leather and a whiff of dark spice lead the way. The wiry palate is on the lean side, offering hints of sour cherry and dark spice alongside firm acidity and dusty, rather fleeting tannins. Racy acidity keeps it light on its feet. Drink now.
Name: Ormanni 2014  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of stewed prune and wet underbrush follow over to the evolved palate together with a hint of dried cranberry and clove. Dusty, fleeting tannins give it an abrupt finish.
Name: Coli 2013 Pratale  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Coconut, French oak, vanilla and dried sage aromas follow through to the austere, assertive palate alongside firm acidity. Unyielding, close-grained tannins give it an astringent, lean finish. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak.
Name: Querciabella 2014  Chianti Classico

Description: A lovely wine, this is soft and layered with complex notions of raisin cake, cranberry and dried cherry. Soft and supple in texture, it has a lasting grip of leather and coffee. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, showing complexity and balance.
Name: Pride Mountain 2014 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)

Description: Sophisticated and hearty, this is a well-made 100% varietal wine, juicy in black cherry, with a nice waft of wood-fired-oven smoke. Thick, it finds a smoothness of velvety texture as it opens, offering a length of leather, tobacco and black pepper.
Name: Pestoni Family 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Rutherford)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the well-known vineyard in the appellation, this is made entirely from the variety, and it has a texture and flavor of fruit leather, plum and dried cherry, as well as an herbal earthy note of tomato leaf. The tannins are a tad harsh, but mellow in the glass.
Name: Muscardini 2014 Unti Vineyard Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, aged for 20 months in French and Hungarian oak. Tart and plushy, it has a level of rusticity that serves it well. Thick tannins meet a smoky oaky core of wood and dried herb.
Name: Luna 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a plush, rustic and somewhat impenetrable wine in terms of tannins and ripeness. It offers a strong taste of tobacco, leather, earth and dried fruit.
Name: Muscardini 2014 Alice Vineyard Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This is a hugely extracted wine that traffics in earthy mushroom and a streak of greenness that comes off as somewhat disjointed and harsh.
Name: Benessere 2015 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Sangiovese (St. Helena)

Description: Classic Sangiovese aromas of new leather, wild berry, baking spice and a whiff of menthol lead the way on this full-bodied red. It's juicy and delicious, delivering crushed raspberry, fleshy black cherry, cinnamon and pipe tobacco framed in polished and velvety tannins. Drink now through 2027.
Name: Le Gode 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This wine is spot on with the modern Aussie movement towards light-bodied, moderate-alcohol wines, with little to no oak influence. From the cool climes of Western Victoria, this is downright delicious and a total bargain. Bright, ripe red cherry, chocolate, cola and violet notes lead into a plush yet zingy palate of juicy red fruits, silky soft tannins and a long tangy finish.
Name: Point Ormond 2015 Sangiovese (Grampians)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle at first, this bottling starts to show sweet hints of roasted red cherry on the nose along with leather and strong tobacco scents. It's elegantly layered on the well-structured sip, offering dried raspberry, pencil shavings, cocoa, bittersweet chocolate and more leather.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2013 Sangiovese (Monterey County)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of oak lead the nose. The succulent palate presents black plum, fleshy morello cherry, cinnamon and a hint of mocha alongside pliant tannins and zesty acidity. It's easy drinking, vibrant and delicious. Drink through 2018.
Name: Roberto Mascelloni 2013 01 Sangiovese (Orcia)

Description: Made from organically farmed vineyards, with native yeast and old barrels, this wine is a melting pot of bright cranberry and raspberry, smoke, toast, florals and sweet herbs. Medium bodied, with silky tannins, and plenty of terroir expression, it's well priced to boot. A win all around.
Name: Fairbank Sutton Grange 2015 Sangiovese (Bendigo)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting ripe black-skinned fruit, pressed blue flower, earth and a balsamic note waft out of the glass. Made with 100% Sangiovese grown according the principles of biodynamic viticulture, the compact full-bodied palate offers black cherry jam, licorice, sage and espresso. Close-grained tannins leave a firm finish.
Name: Podere Forte 2012 Petrucci Sangiovese (Orcia)

Description: This wine is a light red, but packaged like a rosé, and shows rich aromas of ripe black plum and red cherries, mouth-filling body and generous plummy, meaty flavors. It's very enjoyable to start an evening with and is full bodied enough to pair with big proteins.
Name: Fifi 2014 Rosé of Sangiovese (California)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh, vibrant and tangy, this is a great example of a dry light-bodied but very appetizing wine. Canteloupe and peach aromas lead to citrus and raspberry flavors that are lean but tasty. It's one of the best California Sangiovese rosés.
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Rosato di Sangiovese (North Coast)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good depth of flavor and a nicely tannic texture make this hearty wine interesting and appetizing. Earth, oak and chocolate waft from the glass and turn to substantive red cherry and red-currant flavors on the palate, while firm tannins and good acidity give grip to the mouthfeel.
Name: Naggiar 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Here's a savory enjoyable red that opens with fruity aromas of wild berry, pressed blue flower and a whiff of culinary spice. The round juicy palate offers fleshy red cherry, crushed raspberry and a note of star anise alongside chewy tannins. It has an open, sunny charm.
Name: SassodiSole 2015 Rosso Sangiovese (Orcia)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A beautiful shade of dark pink and light mauve, this bottling offers aromas of raspberry Jolly Rancher and red licorice on the rather intense nose. There is compelling texture to the sip, and bright red fruit, rounded by slightly sour lime.
Name: Hart 2016 Vineyard Select Rosé of Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smooth texture and broadly fruity flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to sip and swallow. Red cherry and plum aromas lead to ripe fruit on the palate and light butter and vanilla accents.
Name: Renwood 2015 Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is quite light in color, with delicate aromas of cigar box, herb and spice. The cherry flavors are full and tart, with spice notes on the finish.
Name: Wilridge 2014 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Sangiovese (Naches Heights)

Description: Classic Sangiovese aromas of violet, plum, red berry and a whiff of baking spice float from the glass. Round and medium-bodied, the palate doles out ripe morello cherry and raspberry jam while a hint of licorice signals the finish.
Name: Trequanda 2012 Riserva Sangiovese (Orcia)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in 45% new French oak, aromas of cocoa, vanilla and barrel spice are at the fore followed by full-bodied but still tart raspberry and cranberry flavors. It brings a bit of heat along with it.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Sangiovese (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, aromas of barrel spice, herb and red fruit rise up from the glass. The palate packs a mouthful of red-fruit flavors, with the tannins showing a bit of astringency.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of plum and herb. The palate is supple in feel, showing little apparent new oak influence and zippy acidity. It doesn't seem entirely varietal aromatically but still brings appeal and should fit in well at the dinner table.
Name: Cavatappi 2015 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The high-toned aromas of raspberry, barrel spice and herb bring a touch of heat along with them. The palate offers tart tangy acidity, with the tannins seeming a bit bunched up.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an easygoing, mouthfillng and fruity wine that's plump with blackberry and cherry flavors. It has a soft texture despite high octane and very little tannin.
Name: Deaver 2014 Sangiovese (Amador County)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has meaty aromas followed by red cherry and cranberry flavors that turn sharp on the finish. It has a dry feel in the mouth, is balanced toward acidity, and has quite stiff tannins.
Name: Prima Materia 2014 Estate Bottled Sangiovese

Description: A rather light red color and a lean flavor profile make this medium-bodied wine a good mealtime pour that doesn't hog the spotlight. It smells like cranberries and dried earth and tastes lightly tart and cherrylike.
Name: Girasole 2016 Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas on this wine seem a bit candied, with notes of red currant, raspberry and cranberry. Flavors are fresh, with plenty of tart, puckering cranberry notes throughout. There's not a lot of complexity, but it should fit in well at the dinner table, with the oak dialed way back and the acid up.
Name: Cavatappi 2016 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Though tart and chalky, this has interesting notes of rose petals and saddle leather, with light berry fruit. It does show varietal specificity, but the wine fades quickly and lacks concentration.
Name: Spangler 2013 Sangiovese (Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Kudos to winemaker Doug Margerum for holding onto this extremely pleasing wine long enough for all the components to come together. Six years in, the aromas of cola, black cherry, rose petal, pepper dust and crushed gravel are still fresh and vibrant, while the palate remains upright due to structural tannins. Flavors of blackberry, raspberry and baking spice abound, making for an elegant wine.
Name: Cent'Anni 2011 Buoni Anni Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling offers cassis, blackberry syrup, crushed slate and lots of purple flowers on the nose. It's a big and boisterous expression of the grape at first sip, which bursts with boysenberry, but then grows very mineral in the midpalate, with gravel and lava rock flavors. The tight tannic structure goes deep into the finish.
Name: Rideau 2015 The Englishmen Camp 4 Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High toned aromas mark the nose of this wine, including dried herb, fresh plum, huckleberry and spice. Its purple fruit flavors are rich and lush, with a pleasing purity that carries through the finish. It's uncharacteristic of Sangiovese but brings undeniable appeal.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2015 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Straight down-the-middle aromas of red cherry, salt and pepper, vanilla and a touch of brioche show on this bottling of a clone that's related to the Brunello region. It's lighter bodied on the palate and quite easy to quaff, with light cherry and strawberry flavors riding a gravelly texture.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's macerated cranberry, raspberry jam and dried orange peel aromas are bright. Its raspberry and cranberry flavors are sweet and focused, delivering a lot of appeal, though seeming a bit ripe.
Name: Casa Smith 2015 Cinghiale Wahluke Slope & Rosebud Vineyards Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's barrel aromas are upfront, suggesting vanilla and sawdust along with dried cherry and raspberry. Fruit and oak notes play off each other on the palate, with vanilla-rich barrel notes winning out on the finish.
Name: Chandler Reach 2012 Reserve Parris Estate Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding raspberry, tobacco, herb, cedar and barrel spice aromas are followed by ripe cherry flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable but lacks precision.
Name: Stottle 2013 6 Prong Vineyard Sangiovese (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Electric pink in color, this brings wild strawberry, cherry, watermelon and spice aromas. The palate is broad and heavy, lacking lift.
Name: Finn Hill 2016 Blondie Rosé of Sangiovese (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reductive aromas distract from the fruit and barrel notes in this wine. The palate brings medium-bodied, mouth-puckering cranberry and cherry flavors. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.
Name: Kestrel 2013 Falcon Series Estate Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very treacly aromas of overripe strawberry, brown sugar and maple syrup show on this dessert-like wine. It's very sweet on the palate, with sweet tea, prune and raisin flavors.
Name: Dubost 2012 Blood of Jove Off-Dry Sangiovese (Adelaida District)

Description: Dark reddish-pink in color, this wine exudes the essence of a strawberry patch both in flavor and aroma, adding to the fruitiness with complementary flavors of peach. Expansive and duly ripe, it incorporates richer layers of vanilla that add a touch of sweetness to the finish.
Name: Trentadue 2016 Estate Rosato di Sangiovese (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 95% Sangiovese and 5% Aglianico, hailing from Seven Hills, Loess, Mill Creek Upland and Serra Pedace vineyards. Aromas of cranberry, raspberry, and fruit leather lead to quite tart cranberry flavors. The concentration doesn't quite seem all there to stand up by itself but it should fit in well at the dinner table.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2014 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and lively aromas of dried red berries, concentrated roses, cola and black plums show on the nose of this very accessible and pleasurable Sangiovese. The cohesive palate integrates cherry, cola and milk-chocolate flavors into an easy-drinking frame, perfect for barbecues or family-style Italian meals.
Name: Midnight 2013 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very appealing pale-peach color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry and cherry. The flavors are tart and decisive, with a lingering finish.
Designation: And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of
Name: Underground Wine Project 2016 And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Restrained aromatically, this bottling shows touches of crushed lava rocks, black pepper and blackberry on the nose. Balsamic vinegar and sour cherry flavors mark the sip, with very sticky tannins.
Name: Bella Luna 2012 Grosso Sangiovese (San Benito County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Wonderful, spicy oak aromas and ripe flavors give this eye-opening, full-bodied wine a lot to like. It has hints of new leather, cedar and tobacco along with opulent plum-like fruit and a lavish layer of fine tannins to support all the richness. This is the third 90-plus showing in the last four vintages.
Name: La Folia Winery 2013 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This wine has more depth, volume and textural roundness than most of its peers in California, seasoning its ripe fruit flavors with the herb, leather and sage accents characteristic of the variety. It has good balance, complexity and a lingering finish that begs for another sip.
Name: Masthead 2014 Mohr-Fry Ranch Block 433 Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: Orange-red in color, this wine is dry, meaty and weighty, with a broadness on the palate. Peach skin and flesh are strongly represented in flavor, feeling at once refreshing and bold enough to stand up well to food.
Designation: Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato Di
Name: Benessere 2016 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato Di Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Description: Good concentration and a firm mouthfeel make this full-bodied wine a fine pairing for osso buco or mushroom risotto. It has robust ripe berry, anise and dark chocolate flavors, velvety tannins that seem to coat the palate, and a lingering, rich finish.
Name: Longevity 2013 Sangiovese (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is an excellent, deeply colored and moderately tannic wine with style. It follows its tamarind aromas with rich plum, prune and chocolate flavors, accented with mild vanilla and nutmeg notes.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2013 Sangiovese (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very smooth and mouthfilling, this medium-bodied wine has a harmonious feeling about it. Ripe, juicy fruit and cola flavors meet soft tannins, and a broad, expansive texture carries them into the finish.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2013 Reserve Sangiovese (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A buttery note tops the vivid cherry and blackberry flavors in this dry, straightforward, no-nonsense wine. Its fruitiness makes it attractive and fun to sip, while fine tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.
Name: Girasole 2015 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nicely lean and not overly fruity, this medium-bodied wine has the typical firm tannins, leathery aromas and herbal flavors of the grape variety and makes a nice change of pace from the usual California menu of full-bodied, oaky concoctions.
Name: Kendric 2014 Reward Ranch Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is lighter in color, with aromas of sawdust, cherry and barnyard. The style is quite faint, with spice flavors on the finish.
Name: Ribbon Cliff 2014 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a dense bottling of the Italian grape, with salt-and-pepper touches spicing up the baked raspberry, cranberry and ginger cake aromas on the nose. The palate shows deep flavors reminiscent of dried strawberry, rust, leather and shaved chocolate. Firm tannins provide structure.
Name: Pianetta 2014 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Fillippini family has been growing grapes in eastern Paso Robles since 1982, and this is among their better modern bottlings. The nose offers light sandalwood, ripe cranberry and river stone mineral scents. Its punchy berry fruit is underlaid with leather and cigar accents on the palate, where buoyant acidity and grippy tannic structure pervades.
Name: Le Vigne 2014 Di Domenico Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of cherry, herb and raspberry are light but show a pleasing sense of purity. The palate is tart and elegant, with the oak dialed way back and the bright acidity pulling together the finish. Pair it with food to see it at its best.
Name: Eight Bells 2014 Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This almost-opaque bottling from the Hidden Valley Vineyard unleashes a powerful wave of aromas, from concentrated blueberry to licorice and vanilla to plum sauce. Cassis flavors permeate the dense palate, feeling lavish and nearly over-the-top.
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2014 Illuminatus Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very appealing pale peach color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry and cherry. The flavors are tart and decisive, with a lingering finish.
Designation: And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of
Name: Underground Wine Project 2016 And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Electric pink in color, the aromas are light, with notes of cherry, strawberry and herb. It drinks dry with tart elegant fruit flavors that linger.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2016 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pale pink colored wine offers appealing aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher and cherry. It drinks off dry with mouthwatering cherry flavors.
Name: Maryhill 2016 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling boasts cedar-driven aromas augmented with rust, strawberry, leather and lava rock scents. The palate leads with cigar-like tobacco notes, building toward heavy red fruit and framed by sticky tannins.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Dos Ninas Vineyard Therese Vineyards Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's just a trace of color on this wine. Light aromas of citrus and herb are followed by dry-fruit flavors. The concentration seems quite dilute.
Name: Vital 2016 Rosé Wine Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Candied fruit aromas combine with fresh, jammy strawberry and cherry flavors for a light, almost sweet impression in this bright pink wine.
Name: LangeTwins 2016 Estate Grown Rosé Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: This boasts intense aromas of red berry, blue flower and tilled earth while the lingering refined palate delivers morello cherry, strawberry and a touch of star anise. Silky tannins and bright acidity provide the elegant, vibrant framework. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Condé 2013 Raggio Brusa Predappio Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Boushey Vineyard makes up two-thirds of this wine, with the rest coming from Seven Hills. Fruit-forward aromas of cranberry, cherry, plum and spice lead to a thoroughly charming fruit-laden palate that shows a lot of purity. It's unabashed in its appeal.
Name: Covington 2012 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Blackberry, cedar and vanilla aromas lead the way on this polished savory red. The medium-bodied juicy palate doles out red plum, wild cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Condé 2013 Predappio Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese grapes and without added sulfites, this offers aromas of blackberry, black tea and thyme. The juicy savory palate tastes of blackberry jam, raspberry and clove framed in smooth, supple tannins and fresh acidity. Drink soon to enjoy the succulent fruit flavors.
Name: Tre Monti 2015 SoNo Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Blackberry, underbrush and cooking spice aromas take shape in the glass. The savory juicy palate delivers black cherry, raspberry jam, new leather and a touch of white pepper while polished tannins provide support. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Braschi 2013 Il Costone Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of dried violet, black-skinned berry and cooking spice take center stage while the dense palate offers black plum, mocha and a touch of vanilla alongside solid tannins. It's already accessible so drink soon.
Name: Tre Monti 2012 Petrignone Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, baking spice and mocha lead the nose while the ripe palate offers black plum, vanilla and tobacco. Assertive tannins and the heat of evident alcohol provide the framework. Drink through 2019.
Name: Tre Monti 2013 Thea Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Made with 98% Sangiovese and 2% Ancellotta, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and a whiff of new leather. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and a hint of licorice framed in fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Enjoy through 2021.
Name: Fattoria Zerbina 2013 Pietramora Marzeno Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and cooking spice lead the nose. The savory juicy palate offers ripe black cherry, leather and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Enio Ottaviani 2013 Sole Rosso Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Made with organic Sangiovese grapes, this opens with aromas of red berry, new leather and a whiff of violet. The bright juicy palate offers crushed raspberry, red cherry, sage and a hint of clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Tre Monti 2015 Campo di Mezzo Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting blackberry, underbrush and a whiff of new leather. The concentrated, savory palate shows black cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Designation: Vigna del generale Predappio di Predappio
Name: Nicolucci 2013 Vigna del generale Predappio di Predappio Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Black plum, baking spice and cedar aromas lead the way. On the firm medium-bodied palate, notes of mocha and toasted oak underscore blackberry jam while assertive tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.
Name: Battistini 2013 Solstizio Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Appellation: Colli di Faenza, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of iris, blackberry and an earthy whiff of undergrowth. The fresh juicy palate delivers raspberry jam, black tea and dried thyme while smooth tannins provide flexible support. Enjoy soon.
Name: Rontana 2015 Col Mora Sangiovese (Colli di Faenza)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, red berry and cooking spice. The round savory palate delivers juicy red plum, clove and a touch of vanilla alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Tenuta La Viola 2015 Il Colombarone Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and cooking spice. The savory palate offers black currant, clove and a whiff of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Condé 2015 Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and cooking spice take center stage. The enjoyable, savory palate offers black cherry, clove and a hint of sage alongside refined tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Nicolucci 2015 Tre Rocche Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: You'll find aromas of red berry, underbrush and tilled soil on this savory red. The lively palate delivers raspberry, cinnamon and clove alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Noelia Ricci 2015 Godenza Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched soil and bell pepper lead the nose. The dense dark palate delivers juicy black plum, tobacco and clove framed in chewy tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Morini 2013 Nonno Rico Oriolo Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Subtle aromas of black-skinned fruit and baking spice waft out of the glass. The straightforward palate evokes black plum, vanilla and tobacco while assertive tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.
Name: Fattoria Paradiso 2013 Vigna delle Lepri Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas suggesting scorched soil, cedar and black-skinned berry are front and center. The concentrated palate delivers black plum, clove and licorice alongside chewy tannins. Enjoy this one through 2020.
Name: Balia di Zola 2013 Redinoce Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This deeply colored wine opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and vanilla. On the dense palate, notes of toast and tobacco underscore mature black plum. Assertive tannins leave a mouthcoating finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Drei Donà 2013 Pruno Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of violet, underbrush and baking spice lead the way. The savory palate doles out black cherry, clove and white pepper set against firm tannins and lively acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Bissoni 2015 Girapoggio Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Scents of toast, underbrush and black-skinned berry come together on this. The dense palate delivers clove, cedar and tobacco alongside assertive tannins that leave a somewhat raspy finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Podere La Berta 2014 Olmatello Sangiovese Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Made with 85% Sangiovese and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of tilled soil, black-skinned berry and mocha. The firm palate delivers tobacco, toast and a whiff of black currant. Tightly packed tannins leave a rather drying finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Trerè 2013 Amarcord d'un Ross Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of black plum, toast and vanilla carry over to the firm palate together with a touch of licorice. Assertive tannins lend solid support. Drink through 2019.
Name: Bissoni 2013 Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This opens with aromas of tilled soil, underbrush and prune. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, vanilla and toasted oak alongside chewy tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.
Name: Celli 2013 Bron& Ruseval Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of coconut, vanilla and cassis lead into the dense palate along with black cherry jam, mocha and toast. Chewy drying tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2019.
Name: Bissoni 2013 Bertinoro Riserva Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of black-skinned berry and a whiff of baking spice. The straightforward palate delivers black plum, clove and leather alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Podere La Berta 2015 Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This straightforward red opens with aromas of leather, game and black-skinned fruit. The firm palate delivers prune, cedar and tobacco alongside assertive tannins that leave a rather grippy finish.
Name: Tenuta Casali 2013 Quartosole Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Subtle aromas of blackberry, tilled earth and dark spice lead the way. On the straightforward palate, clove and a touch of white pepper add interest to black cherry while smooth tannins provide an accessible framework. Enjoy soon.
Name: Tenuta La Viola 2015 Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting scorched earth, black-skinned fruit and a hint of vanilla lead the nose while the straightforward palate delivers black plum, clove and a touch of cedar. Smooth tannins provide pliant support. Drink soon.
Name: Podere La Berta 2014 Solano Sangiovese (Romagna)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice while the round palate shows black plum, clove and a hint of sage. Pliant tannins provide easygoing support. Enjoy soon.
