Description: This is a beautiful wine from a great vintage. It has a rich fragrance of underbrush, mushroom and truffle, with ripe black-cherry, mint and rosemary accents. It's still young with exuberant but supple tannins and racy acidity. Drink 2016–2025.
Name: Villa Cafaggio 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: Aria is a stunning Chianti Classico, boasting earthy, underbrush aromas with hints of subdued oak. The palate delivers fabulous, juicy plum and black-cherry layered with well integrated vanilla and espresso. It's still tight and tannic so give this a few more years.
Name: Casa al Vento 2011 Aria  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Here's a classically crafted Brunello, with nuanced aromas of violet, iris, tobacco and clove on the nose. The palate delivers a core of black cherry flavor punctuated with nutmeg, eucalyptus and truffle. It's tight and tannic now, but should develop great complexity with time; drink 2016–2023.
Name: Castelli Martinozzi 2008  Brunello di Montalcino

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from Sangiovese selected from top sites in Carpineto's Poggio Sant'Enrico vineyards and aged in barriques, this wine opens with plum, underbrush and coffee aromas. The palate is youthful and well balanced, delivering restrained black fruit, spice, espresso and oak flavors. Drink after 2016.
Name: Carpineto 2004 Poggio Sant'Enrico  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This earthy Chianti Classico offers bold aromas of truffle, underbrush, dried tobacco and ripe berry. The palate delivers succulent black-cherry balanced by white pepper, cinnamon and hints of carob. Drink now–2020.
Name: Fattoria Tregole 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: Made from organic grapes, this succulent wine delivers balsamic aromas and juicy black cherry flavors layered with cinnamon and white pepper. It's radiant and structured, with big round tannins and edgy acidity. Drink 2015–2025.
Name: Fontodi 2010  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Torcalvano has fruit and spice aromas of plum, cassis and vanilla, as well as hints of coffee and oak. The palate boasts bracing but fine tannins, and reveals a black-cherry core layered with notes of espresso, white pepper and cinnamon.
Name: Folonari 2010 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This lovely selection has intensely floral fragrances of rose and iris, with whiffs of balsam and leather. The palate shows gorgeous, ripe black cherry and raspberry flavors accented by white pepper and baking spices alongside big, polished tannins. Delicious and drinking well now, so enjoy through the next two or three years.
Name: Poggio Scalette 2011  Chianti Classico

Description: This stunning wine boasts a bright, vibrant character. The palate has a juicy core of black cherry spiced with nutmeg and cinnamon that recalls Christmas cake. It's fresh and delicious, with silky tannins that make it easy to enjoy soon.
Name: Villa Cafaggio 2010 Basilica Cafaggio Single Estate  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This young wine shows underbrush aromas, with hints of forest floor and mushroom. The palate offers brooding but ripe tannins, with a juicy berry and plum core layered with sweet vanilla and café au lait accents.
Name: Casalvento Radda 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This spicy rosso combines structure with sheer drinkability. It offers a beautiful bouquet of rose, violet and strawberry, while the palate reveals ripe black cherry, white pepper, tea and cinnamon flavors wrapped up in silky tannins. This is easily drinkable now, and best enjoyed young.
Name: Canalicchio di Sopra 2011  Rosso di Montalcino

Description: This riserva shows ripe aromas of plum and wild cherry accompanied by notes of underbrush and oak. It has lush black-cherry, raspberry, mint and cinnamon flavors, and hints of vanilla and chocolate. It's enjoyable now, thanks to the soft, round tannins and easygoing palate.
Name: Tolaini 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Avignonesi's Vino Nobile offers an alluring fragrance of rose petal and balsamic herbs along with cherry and spice accents. The palate delivers restrained black fruit flavors alongside notes of chocolate and licorice. Despite the tannic finish, this is fast approaching its ideal drinking window.
Name: Avignonesi 2010  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: This has lovely aromas of violet, iris and woodland berries, with just a hint of truffle. The palate is still young and tightly knit, with ripe cherry, plum and red currant flavors alongside a hint of green pepper. Drink 2015–2022.
Name: Antico Borgo di Sugame 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This charming wine shows floral fragrances of violet and rose, with hints of meat juices and herbs. The juicy palate delivers flavors of black cherry and plum alongside well-integrated oaky accents of carob and vanilla. Hold onto this for a few more years to develop additional complexity.
Name: Querceto di Castellina 2010 L'Aura  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has classic aromas of wild cherry, leather and truffle. The palate delivers notes of ripe cherry, raspberry, mint, white pepper and white chocolate. A fresh and well-balanced selection.
Name: Renieri 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This delightful rosso has enticing fragrances of violet, iris and red berry. The bright palate delivers wild cherry, white pepper and mint flavors framed by silky tannins. This is made to be drunk young, so enjoy soon.
Name: Casisano Colombaio 2011  Rosso di Montalcino

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: I Quadri offers violet and iris aromas accented by vanilla and toasted oak sensations. The palate shows a black pepper streak wrapped around a core of plum and ripe cherry, finishing on a roasted coffee bean note. It's forward and ready to enjoy soon.
Name: Bindella 2009 I Quadri  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This is a bold and savory selection, with intense fragrances of violet, plum and red licorice. The rich palate shows prune, cassis, clove, anisette and espresso, with big but round tannins and surprising freshness for the vintage. The finish ends with the warmth of alcohol.
Name: La Ciarliana 2007 Vigna Scianello  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This is still somewhat closed, with subdued aromas of underbrush and tobacco leaf. The palate is not too expressive, but reveals red cherry, white pepper and cinnamon flavors. This tannins are still very astringent, though they should soften with time. Drink after 2018.
Name: Casisano Colombaio 2008  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Here's a luminous Chianti Classico, offering upfront wild cherry, violet and iris aromas. The bright palate delivers red cherry and cinnamon flavor alongside notes of truffle and licorice. Young and forward, this is already enjoyable.
Name: Badia a Coltibuono 2011 RS  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This shows ripe cherry, plum and spice aromas, with hints of oak and mint. The palate is still a bit shy but reveals restrained notes of wild cherry, pepper and toasty, well-integrated oak. Drink 2015–2020.
Name: Fattoria Poggerino 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This wine has an intriguing fragrance of dill, violet, black fruit, white pepper and new oak. The palate is still rather closed, but reveals ripe black cherry notes alongside hints of well-integrated oak and mint. It has elegant tannins and ample length to the finish.
Name: Felsina 2011 Berardenga  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This is a bright selection, showing wild cherry, leather and balsamic notes alongside hints of well-integrated oak, pepper and espresso. It's not complex but it has a silky texture and is enjoyable now. Michael Skurnik Wines, Estate Wines.
Name: Le Cinciole 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This shows underbrush aromas layered with hints of espresso and oak, all accompanied by juicy cherry, mint and vanilla flavors. It's not the most typical Chianti Classico, but supple and delicious nonetheless. It would pair well with chicken cacciatore. Amici Imports, Siema Wines.
Name: Castello di Radda 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: Violet and underbrush aromas lead on the nose of this wine, with glimmers of violet and ripe plum. The palate has wild cherry, mint and spice flavors, dusted with a hint of espresso. This is well-balanced and fresh, and should develop complexity over the next few years.
Name: Vignamaggio 2010 Terre di Prenzano  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This boasts ripe black fruit, chocolate and coffee aromas alongside clove and well-integrated oaky notes that all carry through to the palate. It has fresh acidity and round tannins, and will pair well with game and mildly seasoned cheeses.
Name: Bandini Villa Pomona 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: From the very warm 2007 vintage, this offers earthy aromas of underbrush, truffle and overripe berry. The palate is warm and evolved, with concentrated black fruit and round tannins, but it lacks freshness and energy. Drink soon.
Name: Valdipiatta 2007 Vigna d'Alfiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Rancia Riserva opens with ripe plum, red currant and bell pepper aromas. The palate shows flavors of black fruit, chocolate and soy sauce alongside coffee and oak notes. It has nervous energy and intensity, but should develop nicely over the next few years.
Name: Felsina 2009 Rancia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This is a charming wine, with scents of violet and crushed cherry. The palate shows dense wild-cherry flavor alongside hints of pepper, vanilla and espresso. It's not overly complex, but it is delicious.
Name: Castello La Leccia 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This rosso has earthy fragrances of truffle, underbrush and smoke, with a hint of meat juice. The palate offers ample black cherry flavor, with hints of menthol and white pepper. It's warm and forward, so drink soon.
Name: Castelli Martinozzi 2011  Rosso di Montalcino

Description: Here's a rosso offering underbrush, tobacco leaf and bright cherry aromas accompanied by ripe berry, pepper and mushroom flavors. Structured but thoroughly enjoyable, pair this with pasta topped with meat sauces or mildly seasoned cheeses.
Name: Argiano 2011  Rosso di Montalcino

Description: This brooding wine has a ripe character that reflects the warmth of the vintage. It shows dense plum, black pepper, coffee, chocolate and vanilla sensations, along with well integrated oak.
Name: Il Molino di Grace 2009  Chianti Classico

Description: This shows obvious toasted oak aromas along with notes of black fruit. The palate offers oak-driven flavors of chocolate, espresso and vanilla that spice up the dark berry core, along with bracing yet round tannins.
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2010 Clemente VII  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Le Ellere has aromas of black fruit, red currant and bell pepper. The palate shows black-cherry and plum flavors layered with chocolate, espresso and vanilla. An ideal match for lean grilled steaks or mildly seasoned cheeses.
Name: Castello d'Albola 2010 Le Ellere  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: From the scalding 2007 vintage, this riserva has ripe black fruit aromas and hints of toasted oak and burnt rubber. The palate shows ripe black fruit, espresso and vanilla flavors, and finishes abruptly with drying wood tannins.
Name: Antico Colle 2007 Il Saggio Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Aged partly in concrete vats, this wine shows delicate aromas of white pepper, clove and plum. The palate reveals juicy berry and red currant flavors with black pepper accents. This is still tightly wound, with astringent tannins that need time to soften. David Bowler Wines, Lemma Wine Company.
Name: Candialle 2011 La Misse  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Beradenga shows underbrush and oak aromas along with berry and white pepper. The palate boasts new-wood notes of vanilla and and espresso as well as dense black cherry. It has dusty tannins that finish on a dry note.
Name: Felsina 2010 Berardenga  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This wine has a ripe, black fruit fragrance of plum and spice. The dense palate shows rich cherry and new-oak flavors but it's more tannic than fresh, a reflection of the vintage.
Name: I Fabbri 2011 Lamole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This reflects the intense heat of the vintage, showing mature berry and plum aromas with toasted notes. The palate is warm and shows ripe—nearly over-ripe—black-cherry, chocolate, espresso and spice flavors. It closes with astringent tannins.
Name: Castello di Bossi 2011  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's first vintage of Sangiovese, this has notes of cranberry, raspberry and underbrush are somewhat faint and accented by tart, cranberry-like acidity with a bit of heft to the tannins.
Name: Cliff Creek 2009 Sangiovese (Southern Oregon)

Description: This shows pretty floral and earthy aromas, with hints of coffee bean and espresso. The palate shows lots of upfront vanilla and oak tones, along with plum and black cherry fruit flavors in the background.
Name: Bonacchi 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This has iris and cherry aromas layered with evident oak and burnt rubber sensations. The palate opens much better thanks ripe berry, spice and licorice flavors along with oak, coffee bean and espresso notes.
Name: Il Colombaio di Cencio 2010 I Massi  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made from Sangiovese, this refreshing rosé has floral aromas of iris and white violet. The palate offers strawberry, crushed cherry and pink grapefruit flavors. Thanks to its crisp nature, this would work wonderfully with pizza.
Name: Casalvento Radda 2012 Rosé Sangiovese (Toscana)

Description: This earthy wine offers intense underbrush and dried tobacco aromas layered with ripe berry and white pepper accents. The palate expresses flavors of ripe plum, cinnamon-spice and a hint of truffle alongside dusty, drying tannins.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2011  Chianti Classico

Description: This straightforward selection offers plum and cherry sensations with hints of espresso and chocolate. The simple style will work well with pasta dishes and cheeses.
Name: Melini 2010 Terrarossa  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of toasted oak, espresso and spice that carry over to the palate along with dark fruit undertones. It's lean and linear without enough rich fruit to carry the assertive oak.
Name: Lornano 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This barrique-aged Chianti Classico shows cherry and espresso aromas. It has very ripe cherry and raspberry flavors that are just shy of overripe, along with vanilla and coffee notes. You'll also find drying wood tannins that cut the palate short. David Bowler Wines, Lemma Wine Company.
Name: Candialle 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This young wine has aromas of violet and forest floor, while the palate reveals ripe strawberry and cherry flavors. Forward, easygoing and approachable now, so enjoy soon.
Name: Banfi 2011  Chianti Classico

Description: This shows ripe berry and oak aromas. The palate delivers an international flavor profile of dominating coffee, vanilla and toasted notes, with a black cherry flavor just beneath the service.
Name: Bonacchi 2010 Casalino  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: The nose of this wine is brimming with dark fruit, spice and toasted-oak fragrances. The palate shows oaky notes of coffee and toast, with soft plum and pepper undertones. It's straightforward, with a drying, tannic finish.
Name: Salcheto 2010  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: This shows underbrush aromas of tobacco leaf and mushroom. The palate is disjointed, with ripe black fruit, green tannins and rustic notes of barnyard.
Name: Franzinelli Socini Guelfi 2010 La Casaccia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This retro-styled Chianti Classico is so dominated by aggressive, raw oak it recalls the 1990s, when producers all over Italy experimented with new barriques—to mixed results. Underneath all the oak, chocolate and coffee, you can detect muffled black fruit sensations. It closes with astringent wood tannins.
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2010 Colledila  (Chianti Classico)

Description: If you're really into invasive oak, this might be your wine. The woody notes on this wine is so fierce, it recalls a lumberyard and fresh sawdust. The aggressive wood covers the fruit, although you can detect some coffee and espresso notes throughout.
Name: Castello di Gabbiano 2010 Bellezza  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This shows rustic sensations of overripe black fruit, animal and hints of barnyard that contrast with harsh and astringent tannins.
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2010  Chianti Classico

Description: This opens with aromas of oak and roasted coffee bean along with pungent whiffs of farm animals. The palate offers a sour cherry flavor and bitterly astringent tannins.
Name: Castello di Selvole 2010  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A perennial best-of-show winner, this lush take on rosé bursts with pretty cherry fruit, light touches of brioche and fresh-baked rolls. It finishes with a kiss of spice.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2012 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale salmon in color, this mostly Sangiovese rosé drinks dry with notes of strawberry, bubblegum and melon. The flavor concentration isn't all there but there's still much to enjoy here.
Name: Ross Andrew 2012 Meadow Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A sweet-smelling wine, with notes of cranberry, white pepper, and Band Aid. It has tart fruit flavors and firm tannins.
Name: Hood Crest 2010 Vintners Select Sangiovese Sangiovese (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: The aromas are light and elusive, with the palate bringing broad, medium-bodied, fresh cranberry flavors. It's cleanly made, if a bit innocuous.
Name: Williamson Vineyard 2009 Sangiovese

Description: Hailing from the winery's Arena Valley Vineyard, this wine has notes of dried cranberry and currant. Cranberry juice-like flavors are accented by oaky spice.
Name: Snake River 2010 Arena Valley Vineyard Sangiovese

Description: Aged 18 months in French oak, this wine is moderately aromatic, with notes of blueberry and mushroom. It's syrupy in feel yet has dry tannins.
Name: Koenig Vineyards 2010 Williamson Vineyard Sangiovese

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As in the past, Leonetti's 2010 Sangiovese was co-fermented with Syrah (11%), and sourced from Seven Hills, Pepper Bridge and Mill Creek Upland vineyards. It's flat-out delicious from the first scents of barrels and fruits, right on through a lush palate rich in flavors of berries, rum-soaked cherries and exotic spices. A long finish, with a smoky/earthy cast, is supported with tart acids.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2010 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A buzz is building around Calaveras County-based La Folia, and this lovely wine shows why. Opening with a subtle oaky aroma, it evolves to offer a lightness of color and texture, enveloped by delicious highlights of cherry and cranberry fruit. Well integrated and well structured, this Sangiovese ends with a long and satisfying finish of violet-inflected plum.
Name: La Folia Winery 2010 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Well-aged and drinking at a peak, this 100% Sangiovese is round and toasty, filled with plush cherry fruit, and just a smidgen of green olive. The barrel aging brings in accents of toasted walnuts through a full, inviting finish.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2008 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light in color and only just faintly aromatic, Amador Cellars' Sangiovese tastes of red cherry and blueberry with a tight tannin structure that suggests giving it 3–5 years more time.
Name: Amador Cellars 2010 Clockspring Vineyard Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Largely tannic and bearing a lot of oak, Amador Foothill's Sangiovese is more savory than sweet, with leather, mocha and herbs rising to the top in taste.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2009 Estate Bottled Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Tannic and powerfully built, Muscardini's Sangiovese veers into slightly sour-currant territory and offers a long, leathery finish.
Name: Muscardini 2010 Pauli Ranch Sangiovese (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale salmon colored, this is a straightforward summer sipper with notes of cherry, watermelon, and wet stone. It drinks dry with a hint of effervescence and tart flavors.
Name: Waterbrook 2012 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a tart and tangy take on Sangiovese, true to its Italian roots, but incorporating the sharp, vivacious fruit of Washington state. Red apple and plum, lightly dusted with chocolate and showing a trace of earthy barnyard, makes this one of the more interesting and complex versions of this grape to come out of the Columbia Valley.
Name: Wine o'Clock 2009 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: There's a cinnamon and clove sweetness in aroma of this Sangiovese, which would be a fine accompaniment to pizza or pasta during the week.
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2010 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Description: A Mendocino Sangiovese with odd vanilla notes that's stingy in fruit and tannin.
Name: Girasole 2010 Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Description: There may be an interesting wine lurking in the dark shadows here, but the oak and alcohol are overpowering in ways that mask the plummy cinnamon within.
Name: Orfila 2010 Estate Sangiovese

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's much to admire in this full-bodied, authoritative Sangiovese. It has the varietal's leafy tartness, with tangy red and purple fruits that are bound by zippy acids and tongue-tingling phenolics.
Name: Kaella 2010 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pure, superripe Sangiovese, and it bears fruit flavors of strawberry preserves and cherry pie, plus a dash of dark chocolate and accents of mint and vanilla. It's big and a bit blocky, but it's loaded with fruit.
Name: Tre Nova 2008 Bonatello Riserva Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This fruit-powered Sangiovese was aged in neutral barrels, and the cranberry and raspberry flavors come through clean and fresh. It's still a bit tight, crisp and compact. Give it some breathing time if you plan to drink it soon.
Name: Trio Vintners 2009 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Flash Point is a new name for the familiar Trio Reserve, which uses grapes that are sourced entirely from the Boushey Vineyard. Here the toasty oak barrel flavors dominate, while the fruit tends toward a light strawberry flavor, with more mocha than grape flavor.
Name: Trio Vintners 2010 Flash Point Reserve Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not really distinguishable from the winery's regular bottling of Sangiovese, this too has just a hint of sour cherry, with leafy, earthy, drying tannins.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chalky and dry, this tastes of barely ripe cherry, with plenty of leafy flavors. The tannins take over quickly in a brief, drying finish.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Oaky and smooth, this is already drinking well and is likely near or already at its peak. The Sangiovese fruit is lightly peppery and somewhat insubstantial, but the wine is harmonious and perfectly sound.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2009 Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Purely varietal, this is a soft and peppery wine, with tastes of berry and chocolate. Despite the relatively high alcohol, it feels light and simple, without depth or complexity.
Name: Michael Florentino 2009 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Volatile and overripe, this raisiny wine seems a bit disjointed. Though not especially high in alcohol, it finishes with a slight burn. Drink soon.
Name: Capstone Cellars 2009 Boushey Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A gorgeous Mendocino County example of Sangiovese, this is fine in its tight baseline of acidity and core flavor of dark dried cherry. Pair this juicy and easy-to-drink selection with pizza, pasta, a burger or cured meats.
Name: Monte Volpe 2009 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Description: Open this wine and you'll feel as though you've stepped into an Italian deli—so finely has it captured the smell of cured meats. The back layers feature cherry and herb, the finish a burst of roasted, toasted oak. This is a great wine to pair with a range of Italian-inspired meals.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2010 Troppo Bella Sangiovese (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A classic Old World-style Sangiovese, this is boldly tannic and resplendent with notes of sage, leather, coffee and bittersweet chocolate, and traces of oak, cherry syrup and vanilla. It would pair expertly with a meaty pizza.
Name: Naggiar 2010 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Sangiovese comes from Red Willow Vineyard, and it would be hard to find a more lovely, elegant rosé from this side of the Atlantic. Light strawberry and melon aromas continue onto the palate, with pinpoint detail and precision.
Name: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2011 Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A truly lovely and engaging nose bears scents of cherries, raspberries and exotic spices. It seems Italian in style, but with New World ripeness and power. A fine example of a domestic Super Tuscan-style wine.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2009 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Showing a lot of new, not-yet-integrated new oak in the nose, this juicy Sangiovese is loaded with aging potential. The bright acidity and hints of herb buttress the generous flavors of strawberry, raspberry, boysenberry and plum. It has excellent concentration and length.
Name: Tulpen 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A cranberry-apple flavor and a hint of pepper define this light, dry rosé. Despite the low alcohol it has little or no residual sugar. Chill it and quaff it on a hot summer day.
Name: Waterbrook 2011 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pure Sangiovese from the Seven Hills Vineyard, this spent three years in barrel. Though listed as “used French oak” the barrel flavors drown out the fruit. The tannins are astringent, with strong streaks of tobacco and vanilla.
Name: Covington 2007 ODE Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light and tight fruit flavors of pretty berry open slowly after plenty of breathing time. The wine is nicely structured, balanced with the addition of 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Malbec—the only drawback is the almost complete lack of aroma. Even with extended airing, the fruit comes up but the nose stays closed, giving the impression of a shortened finish.
Name: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2009 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and lively, this medium-bodied Sangiovese was co-fermented with small amounts of Syrah and Viognier. The Viognier contributes scents of citrus and stone fruit, which add some welcome complexity.
Name: Zerba Cellars 2008 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The reserve seems to have spent more time in barrel, bearing a chocolatey finish, but otherwise it is quite similar to the Marryhill's regular Sangiovese. Slightly higher alcohol makes for a bit more concentration of the strawberry fruit, but the herbal, peppery bite is still there in the finish.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light fruit suggests strawberries with a slightly green edge. The tannins are still a bit rough and tumble, with a peppery kick.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sweet, grapy, raspberry-candy fruit flavors are set against suggestions of dried leaf. Tannins are grainy, with a rough, earthy finish.
Name: Snake River 2009 Arena Valley Vineyard Sangiovese

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's safe to assume that the Sangiovese in this wine was originally intended for Long Shadows super Tuscan Saggi red. Classy fruit is in the forefront, bright and high toned, with sweet cherry notes. A smooth midpalate extends into a pleasing finish that's balanced and silky, with medium length.
Name: Nine Hats 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Crafted from five estate lots, Vino Noceto's Riserva is classic Foothills Sangiovese, with cranberry and dark cherry mingling around a light texture, high acidity and a smooth, caramel finish.
Name: Vino Noceto 2008 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Single vineyard, pure Sangiovese—rare in Washington—yields a compact, fruity wine with cherry and cassis flavors. There is a high-toned lift to the aromas, and plenty of supporting acidity.
Name: Balboa 2008 Candy Mountain Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A firm, somewhat muscular wine, blending in 16% Merlot and aged in neutral oak barrels. Leaf and truffle notes abound, with the distinctively acidic underpinning of Sangiovese. Light strawberry-cherry fruit gently fades through a clean finish.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2009 Seven Hills Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Greg Graziano has been producing Sangiovese for a long time in California and has managed to coax its thick tannins into a swirl of herby, dark plum and dried black-cherry flavors that are rich, ripe and full, ready for grilled Italian-inspired foods.
Name: Monte Volpe 2007 Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Much higher production than Noceto's Riserva and sourced more broadly, this Sangiovese is more rustic and earthy, its cranberry flavors bursting from the seams, and would be yummy with thin-crust pizza.
Name: Noceto 2009 Sangiovese (Amador County)

Description: Rusty in color, with rubbery, chemical aromas. Feels tight, tannic and clampy, with hard, compromised flavors and bitterness to the finish. Astringent and just not that appealing.
Name: Benegas 2008 Libertad Vineyards Sangiovese (Mendoza)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just a single barrel was produced. Volatile and slightly vinegary at first, it improves with aggressive swirling. The fruit remains quite tart, almost to the point of being sour, with little varietal character.
Name: Mercer 2008 Spice Cabinet Vineyard Sangiovese (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Lefore Vineyard in the cobblestone-strewn region known as The Rocks. This is home to some of the oldest Sangio in the valley; planted in 1997. Lovely aromatics with a weave of wild berry, leaf, and sour cherry. The tart fruit is set against rather sharp, herbal tannins.
Name: K Vintners 2008 Guido Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light berry fruit, pleasingly spiced, with the natural acidity of Sangiovese and a light touch with the tannins. It all makes for a light and very pretty wine.
Name: Trio Vintners 2008 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A dense, candied, cherry-infused Sangiovese that's thick in texture, syrup-like, very ripe with intriguing clove and pomegranate flavors. Made from organically grown, dry-farmed grapes. The alcohol is high.
Name: Simaine Cellars 2009 Larry Venturi Vineyard Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Round, forward and fruity, this pleasant red does not scream out its varietal stamp, but it's a perfectly fine quaffer, a bit tart and short in the finish.
Name: Locati Cellars 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: This Lake County Sangiovese tastes slightly green and acidified at first before its bright, tight red cherry fruit makes its way through.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2009 Roumiguiere Sangiovese (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This shakes off a slightly sweaty nose and opens into a soft, round, pleasantly fruity wine with strawberry, mint and spice. There is a hint of new wood, and a mild, almost floral finish.
Name: Le Chateau 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine seems a bit disjointed, as if the fruit ripened unevenly. Prune and fig accents compete with some green notes, and the tannins are unobtrusive to the point of disappearing. Maybe just an awkward phase?
Name: Arbor Crest 2009 Wahluke Slope Vineyard Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit is pruney and the finish tannic. There are big flavors, but the palate impression is of a somewhat disjointed mix of ripe/unripe fruit, earthy tannins, and a streak of leather.
Name: DaMa 2007 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light, with tart rhubarb and strawberry fruit. There's more than a hint of peppery herb, and a tart, quick finish.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2009 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This 100% Sangiovese from this Sierra Foothills Sangiovese specialist has a giant mouthfeel, full of plummy and earthy dark cherry and caramel molasses. As big as the wine is, the tannins are softened and the wine has a long finish. An excellent wine to pair with Italian sausage, risotto or so many other Italian-inspired meals.
Name: Noceto 2008 Marmellata Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A hugely oaky, tannic Chianti-styled wine, mostly Sangiovese, that can use some more time in bottle to soften, its tannins still grippy and chewy. But clearly this is a heady wine that'll show plenty of personality and pairing possibilities with time.
Name: Noceto 2008 Misto Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Another of Noceto's stellar small-production Sangiovese, this one plummy with tobacco and sour cherry most prominent and a slight hint of sweetness as it finishes. Dos Oakies comes from the winery's oldest vineyard section of Sangiovese and has a loyal following of Sangiovese lovers.
Name: Noceto 2008 Dos Oakies Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A tannic Sierra Foothills Sangiovese that's plenty earthy, exhibiting swathes of licorice and berry too.
Name: Naggiar 2009 Estate Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sangiovese lovers will love this wine, so superbly made by Noceto, whose focus on this oft-maligned variety has proven that persistence can pay off. The wine has brightness and depth, notes of red plum, cranberry and spice, solid structure all around and length for days. It just gets better and better in the glass and at $24 is a fair price for a food-friendly wine with depth.
Name: Noceto 2007 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Delicious, sweet scents of perfectly ripe berries rise up from the glass, and it would be easy to say it's just a big old bowl of raspberry fruit. But the structure is excellent, and the proportion of acid and tannin gives the wine substance and depth. It spent 20 months in a mix of oak, but it seems more neutral than intrusive. A fine bottle.
Name: Stottle 2008 Sangiovese (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Shenandoah Valley in California's Sierra Foothills is definitely showing its propensity for Sangiovese here with longtime producer Amador Foothill Winery doing a nice job on this 2007, a wine with lots of dry, dusty tannins and mountain-grown structure that's still got spice and will pair with Italian-inspired dishes with ease.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2007 Estate Bottled Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dark pink in color this rosato, or rosé of Sangiovese, is a delight, fruity and refreshing with some substance behind it and a touch of spice on the finish.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2010 Rosato Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and a little monolithic, but pretty enough, with light strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. On the second day it broadens out a bit, adding hints of tobacco. Slightly hot in the finish.
Name: Barrister 2009 Kiona Vineyard Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Maysie is a small Berkeley-based producer aiming to shake up the world with its take on single-vineyard Italian varietals and this rosato from certified-organic Sangiovese grapes is a great start. It's refreshing and light and dry as a bone.
Name: Maysie Cellars 2010 Masut Vineyard Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and light at first almost like a California Pinot Noir, with red fruit and cola paying a visit, the blend of mostly Sangiovese (79%), 20% Barbera and 5% Petit Verdot drinks big and full with a rustic finish.
Name: Tamás Estates 2009 Riserva Sangiovese (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: At 16.4% alcohol this might as well be a Port, its aroma overwhelmingly sweet, overripe and dominated by caramel syrup. The tannins are mouthpuckeringly dry, too. Tasted two bottles, both of which had crumbling corks.
Name: Longevity 2009 Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Young, tangy and tart, with racy raspberries, strawberries and pomegranate––this is a vividly fruity and penetrating wine. Crisply defined, immaculately fresh, it is structured for both immediate enjoyment and cellaring over the next 6–8 years.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2008 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Some sandalwood incense elevates the nose. In the mouth there is little varietal character, though the Sangiovese is unblended. Tart, chewy, acidic and light, with plenty of acid.
Name: RiverAerie 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A savory, meaty and brooding Sangiovese that's rustic and simultaneously pretty, with an air of soft perfume on the nose. This small-production wine, with tiny bits of Barbera and Primitivo mixed in, would be really good with risotto.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2009 Troppo Bella Sangiovese (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A pretty bottle of Sangiovese in every way—great label, great aromas and bright, cranberry and cherry fruit. From one of Amador County's steady Sangiovese specialists, the Noceto Normale also has pleasing acidity and texture and would be very welcome next to a plate of pasta or pizza or even meats off the grill.
Name: Noceto 2008 Normale Sangiovese (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very pleasant Sangiovese with nice, soft cinnamon flavors and dewey tannins without much hint of oak sourced from the 900-feet-elevation Matagrano Vineyard. The winery suggests the wine be served cool.
Name: Lava Cap 2008 Matagrano Sangiovese (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A juicy, delicious Sangio, whose bright acidity underscores a lush mix of raspberries, blackberries, boysenberries and plum. The alcohol is a substantial 14.8%. The wine benefits from an extra year of bottle age, and is now beginning to hint at grace notes of leaf and tobacco.
Name: Tulpen 2007 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The addition of 11% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Malbec adds meat and muscle to this otherwise moderately light Sangio. Tart strawberry and pomegranate fruit is set against thicker tannins. Firm acids carry flavors of lemon and orange rind into the finish.
Name: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A lively, medium-bodied dry red for casual meals, this is a good example of Australian Sangiovese. Red berry fruit is backed by crisp acids and firmish tannins, making this a good candidate to pair with burgers or pizza. It's 85% Sangiovese, with the balance Merlot and Shiraz.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2009 The Mongrel Sangiovese Blend Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Description: Tannic, crisp and borderline unfriendly when tasted on its own, this is a firmly structured, berry-and-earth-inflected dry red that should be paired with rare steaks or burgers in order for it to shine.
Name: Kangarilla Road 2009 Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light, pale, tart, with generic, simple red berry flavors.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 2008 Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pure Sangiovese, from the estate vineyard. This captures the varietal character nicely, with very pretty cherry and cranberry fruit, high acids, and a bright, accessible style. It tastes like young vines, but shows enormous potential, with a pleasing earthiness to the finish. The first Sangio from Barrister.
Name: Barrister 2008 Kiona Vineyard Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has a little bit of Cabernet Sauvignon (5%) and Merlot (2%), winemaker Mike Januik say it's there “to beef up the structure.” The Sangiovese brings the acid, and tart fruits with a hint of leaf and tomato. Still young vines, but showing great promise.
Name: Novelty Hill 2007 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just a single barrel was made, pure Sangiovese from the Candy Mountain Vineyard. Tight, tart and dark, it captures black cherry fruit with black licorice and a whiff of smoke. At this point in time the tannins and acids seem to be fighting it out for control.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Mostly Sangiovese with a small dose of Petit Verdot, this has attractive vanilla, dark cherry and spice aromatics, but a green, stalky note that lingers throughout. Supple tannins mingle pleasantly with tobacco and smoke on the palate.
Name: Raffaldini 2007 Riserva Sangiovese (Swan Creek)

Description: Bright red cherries and a charred, herbacious oak scent perfume this light bodied North Carolina Sangiovese. Red cherry flavors continue on the palate as well, along with some pleasant tobacco and vanilla spice notes, but the acidity is fairly high, and there's some green in the background too.
Name: Raffaldini 2008 Sangiovese (Swan Creek)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tar, tobacco and smoke can't mask the green tomato leaf characteristics on this ruby red Sangiovese. There are some interesting spice notes, but not a lot of ripeness or concentration in the fruit.
Name: Ventosa 2007 Sangiovese (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a top-tier Washington Sangiovese, the tannins thick and textural, the strawberry fruit threaded with tobacco, the acids juicy and fresh. While you might wish for an alcohol reading a bit lower than the 15.9% that is listed, honesty is its own reward, and clearly this was not watered back. Sip gently, and enjoy.
Name: Tre Nova 2007 Bonatello Riserva Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is intended as an Amarone-style wine, made from half Sangiovese and half Barbera. The alcohol hits almost 17%, yet it is quite dry. Though not especially Amarone-like to this taster, it is an interesting, well-made wine that approaches Port-like intensity without either sugar or spirits.
Name: Tre Nova 2006 Seccopassa 'Appassimento' Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and juicy, showing primary raspberry and strawberry fruit flavor, bold and forward. The generous natural acids provide a tangy base to the fruit, and make it especially food friendly. Best consumed young.
Name: Tre Nova 2008 Bonatello Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A one-of-a-kind 100% Sangiovese from Cadaretta, this pure and expressive wine shows concentrated strawberry fruit presented in a balanced style with acids and tannins in perfect proportion. There is no hint of new oak, just a softening from barrel aging, and a lovely presentation of the pretty young fruit.
Name: Cadaretta 2007 Highclimber Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The nose hints at volatility, and the wine opens with a hard, sharp edge to it. But with breathing time, some pretty cherry fruit emerges, along with varietal scents and streaks of fresh-cut tobacco.
Name: Wilridge 2008 End of the Road Vineyard Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Yummy is the first word that comes to mind, followed by sounds of lip smacking. It's a rich bundle of extracted cherry and raspberry fruit, driven deep with juicy acidity, and bound with ripe tannins. The penetration and vivid tartness are remarkable, and supremely satisfying.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and sappy, like fresh raspberry/cranberry juice, this wine displays the vivid acidity that occurs naturally in the grape, along with some peppery herb from the addition of 8% Syrah and 9% Malbec. It's wild and young, with a finish that tastes like fresh herbs from the garden.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and completely dry, this fresh and fruity rosé is a pretty strawberry and salmon shade, with persistent flavors of cherry candy, lemon oil and nougat. There's a nice citrus snap to the finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2009 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Gravelly and raw on the nose, with clay, raspberry and minerality. The palate feels gritty and tight, while the flavors veer toward baked cherry and candy. Sweet and candied on the finish as well.
Name: Estirpe Tonbert 2008 Oak Sangiovese (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is 100% Sangiovese, with a spicy, peppery herbaceous quality. The fruit is very light, suggesting watermelon and wild strawberries. Simple and pleasant.
Name: Stella Fino 2008 Luminoso Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Exceedingly light fruit, more or less invisible under the velvety coating of chocolaty oak. The chocolate milk flavor and creamy texture are lovely, but the wine needs more fruit support.
Name: Springhouse Cellar 2008 Sangioplasty Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The winery's very limited riserva bottling is made in a single 500-liter puncheon and for the first time features Boushey vineyard fruit. Tannic and displaying impressive mass, it offers somewhat liquorous plum and cherry fruit flavors, with smoke and licorice streaking through the finish.
Name: Trio Vintners 2007 Boushey Vineyard Riserva Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in neutral oak and 100% varietal, this is a fine value. There is great fruit flavor—raspberry and Bing cherry—supported with natural acidity and just a hint of chocolate. This could be a Dry Creek Zinfandel, in terms of its bright berry fruit and lively acidity.
Name: Arbor Crest 2008 Wahluke Slope Vineyard Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very pretty effort, the wine's strawberry and rhubarb flavors are balanced against spring herbs and hints of leaf. The Morrison Lane Sangiovese is blended with 15% Syrah from the Boushey vineyard.
Name: Trio Vintners 2007 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Sangiovese has interesting aromatics, with a pine ester high note over the light strawberry-scented fruit. There is an earthy underpinning; overall a pleasant quaffer with a bit more heft than the winery's other reds.
Name: Stella Fino 2007 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This includes 8% Merlot in the blend. It's done in a warm, open, generous style, with spicy strawberry and pie cherry fruit. The wine displays itself broadly across the palate, thinning out in the finish, with citrus and black pepper.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2008 Seven Hills Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Front-loaded fruit has a strawberry soda pop flavor, but the wine gains a little extra depth from the tannins and barrels, which add texture, spice and a bit of salty chocolate.
Name: Righteous 2008 Righteous Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light fruit, with milk chocolate in the nose and on the palate, yields a simple wine with tangy acidity. It's clean and fresh, but nondescript.
Name: Locati Cellars 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Despite alcohol listed at 15.4%, this seems thin, with watery cherry fruit and not much else. A plastic sensation is all that's left after a quick finish.
Name: Pend d'Oreille 2006 Kestrel Vineyard Sangiovese (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bone dry, toasty, forward, and tart. The flavors orient themselves around a bright core of blueberry fruit. The Sangiovese grape's natural acidity gives structure and support; the fruit and oak are perfectly balanced. A strong streak of licorice and smoke weaves through the finish.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2007 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Lloyd Anderson is consistent and stylish in his winemaking, and his wines show well across the board. This captures the house style—extracted, dark, fruity and full-bodied, with the higher acidity and precision sculpturing of the Sangiovese grape. Lovely spice adds more highlights to the finish.
Name: Walter Dacon 2007 Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Good color, but the very light cranberry fruit flavors have a strong mint streak running down the core of this wine. It's hard to find varietal character here; it's thin, herbal and a bit hard-edged.
Name: Zefina 2005 Sangiovese (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mannina gets some nice accolades for its Sangiovese, and is planting its new vineyard with several different Italian varieties. This new release shows Chianti-like structure, color and texture. It's ripened to pretty strawberry fruit flavors, with suggestions of tobacco leaf and plenty of acid. Neutral barrels were used, allowing the fruit to remain in focus.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2007 Seven Hills Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It seems as if this pure Sangiovese was left to hang as long as possible, and it's got extra color and power. The fruit flavors are edging into a pruney character, with some noticeable heat in the finish.
Name: Stella Fino 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Big and dusty, with plenty of powdered cocoa flavors, the quick impression is of sweet strawberry jam, mocha, and a bit of black pepper. But the tannins are still chalky and rough, and the wine fades quickly.
Name: Flying Trout 2006 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bursting with delicious raspberry and cherry fruit, as sweetly sappy as if it came right off the tree, this sets up the flavors with vivid acidity, and finishes with buttery caramel. Smooth and fruity, beautifully ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2007 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine's strawberry and watermelon fruit is tinged with a hint of tobacco, but the emphasis remains on the fruit from start to finish. Crisp, clean and fresh, it seems completely dry to the taste.
Name: Yalumba 2008 The Y Series Rosé Sangiovese (South Australia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Held back for an extra year, this new Sangiovese from Leonetti was aged in 500 liter ovals. The vines are now a decade old, the flavors deep and dusty, with ripe and mature tannins and hints of coffee and anise. Good grip and focus, with a pure through-line and early suggestions of Brunello-like aging capability.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2006 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This succeeds where many Washington Sangios fail. It retains at least a suggestion of varietal character, with some delicate accents around strawberry fruit—black olive, smoke, tobacco and ripe but not heavy tannins.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2007 Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherry and strawberry fruit, lightly spicy and a bit musky, with scents of truffle and dusty chocolate. Very thin and light in the mouth; the wine seems to melt away, leaving just a little raspberry flavor to work its way through the finish.
Name: Columbia Winery 2007 Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the best of Locati's three new releases, but not a lot different than the others. Light, tart, neutral and showing little ripeness, it's got watermelon and strawberry flavors, lots of citric acid, and no depth.
Name: Locati Cellars 2005 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This belongs up there with Walla Walla's best Sangioveses (Leonetti, Walla Walla Vintners). From the outstanding Morrison Lane vineyard, it's a plush, toasty wine whose strawberry fruit is matched and balanced against toast, vanilla and tobacco. The mouthfeel is generous and somehow crunchy.
Name: Trio Vintners 2006 Morrison Lane Vineyard Sangiovese Riserva Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: One barrel only was made, with grapes from the Boushey vineyard. Scents of barnyard, flavors of peat, earth, leather and herb are wrapped tightly into spicy raspberry fruit. Tart and tangy, this wine would benefit from some additional cellar time.
Name: Wineglass Cellars 2005 Reserve Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Real pretty strawberry fruit shows right away. The 20% Sagemoor vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend was finished in new Hungarian oak, which does add some assertive spice. It's got some grip, plenty of acid, and flavors dominated by the new oak.
Name: Tulpen 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lush and fragrant, and happily and distinctively not tasting like a Washington Cabernet or Merlot, this is a bowl of rose petals and ripe cherries. Strong acids, earthy tannins, slivers of chocolate and a finish of espresso all combine into a lovely and lasting set of flavors. 100% varietal, aged in neutral barrels.
Name: Andrew Will 2007 Cuvée Lucia Ciel du Cheval Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From Boushey and Elerding vineyards, no Washington Sangiovese could ask for a better start. This is 100% varietal, and right away it shows complexity and nuance, mixing spicy berry fruit with hints of citrus and pepper. It gently fades in the midpalate, but has the graceful structure to age over the next 3–5 years.
Name: Wineglass Cellars 2006 Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in neutral oak and blended with about 12% Merlot, this light (12.7% alcohol) Sangiovese is a nice alternative to heavier, more tannic reds. The fruit is simple and clean, strawberry and cherry candy. The balance is good, and the finish persists with malted chocolate highlights.
Name: Cave B 2007 Estate Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very light, could almost be a rosé.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2006 Barrel Select Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nice nose of toast, milk chocolate, confected strawberries and powdered sugar. Light fruits (pomegranate, strawberry) dusted with cocoa and hinting at some of the tobacco notes of Italian Sangiovese.
Name: Balboa 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Cotton candy and bubblegum aromas of cool fermentation and cultured yeasts are pleasant, and the bright pink color is striking. But the flavors are relatively modest, offering little more than crisp acid refreshment.
Name: Mitolo 2008 Jester Rosé Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Description: Shows recognizable varietal character in its aromas and flavors of sour cherry, citrus and tomato, but there's a bit of fatness and sweetness in the mouth. Shows potential.
Name: Robert Oatley 2008 Rosé of Sangiovese (Mudgee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Interesting to see that Washington State vineyards can ripen Sangio in a wide range of microclimates; this is true to the variety with tart acids, sharp flavors of berry, hints of pumpkin pie spice and tobacco, and just enough butterscotch barrel notes to fill in around the rough edges. This is good winemaking, with a tough grape.
Name: Des Voigne Cellars 2006 San Remo Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Like most Washington Sangiovese, a bit nondescript. You won't mistake it for Chianti, but it doesn't have the ripe strawberry and tobacco punch of the best versions from this state. It's light, herbal, and has gentle tannins with suggestions of cracker and grain.
Name: Zerba Cellars 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is definitely one of Washington's best Sangioveses, capturing the astringency and natural acidity of the grape, but filling in the mid-palate with chewy fruit flavors of berry and spicy cranberry. The light herbal characteristics of the vineyard come through, adding details of leaf and herb. Since this is a 2004, it is already showing some development in the bottle and is drinking very well right now.
Name: Chandler Reach 2004 Parris Estate Reserve Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is nothing shy about this wine, but kudos for pulling together a 100% Sangiovese from Red Mountain fruit that comes a tenth of a percentage point short of 15% alcohol. Not easy to do! The result is right in line with the winery's style—big, bold, forward, ready to rock and drinking well right out of the bottle. Don't wait—just enjoy the ripe strawberry fruit, the spice and the toasted almond, oat cracker finish.
Name: Walter Dacon 2006 Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp, earthy and herbal, this has more guts than most Sangioveses—that's the good news—but it doesn't suggest much of what you might consider true varietal character. It's relatively dark for Sangio, and it's a chewy, earthy red wine with some light and tart berry and cherry fruit flavors. A good spaghetti red.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High acid, tart and snappy berry fruit from the excellent Stillwater Creek vineyard yields a clean, precise, varietally driven red wine with excellent color and extraction. The grip and structure are amazing; this would seem to have a long life ahead. It really cuts through and keeps on showing its strength, a rich vein of tart berry and cranberry fruit, pure and focused.
Name: Helix 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made in a Super-Tuscan style, this includes 12% Syrah and 5% Malbec. Young, tight and still a bit severe, it needs airing out. But the fruit has the right structure for Sangiovese which, though rare, does quite well in Washington. Tart and spicy, with cranberry and strawberry fruit flavors under a warm blanket of oak and acid.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Sangiovese grape makes some of the best bone-dry rosés in the Northwest; this being a prime example. The grapes were cold-soaked for four days, then fermented in neutral oak. The strawberry/pie cherry fruit is just ripe enough; the acids fresh and natural; the finish long and utterly satisfying. This should be chilled and enjoyed outdoors on a beautiful day.
Name: Viento 2006 Chukar Ridge Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though no new oak was used in the élévage of this wine, it has a lovely, toasty backdrop to the aromas of fresh rose petals, spicy tobacco and tart plum. This is nicely rounded, keeping the acids from dominating and allowing the fruit to display itself gently and without any rough edges. In the mouth the acids come forward, but they are so fresh, natural and clean that it's a genuine pleasure.
Name: Viento 2005 Cuvée Tuition Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Syrah have been added to the blend, perhaps to amp up the color and cut the acids. This has pretty toast and strawberry tartness, light and lively. The finish hints at green pepper and herb.
Name: Novelty Hill 2005 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Morrison Lane's Sangiovese includes a little Syrah and Carmenère in the blend, giving it a light sprinkling of peppery spice. Tart red fruits fill in the rest.
Name: Morrison Lane 2005 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sangiovese, which includes 8% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Syrah, is lightly scented with cracker, cola and strawberry; it's a gently spicy, simple but enjoyable red.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2006 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a gentle pleasure, 100% Sangiovese, ripened to flavors of raspberry puff pastry, lined with tart, citric acids, and finished with some pleasantly yeasty flavors of fresh-baked bread. Though light and quite tart, it's balanced and enjoyable.
Name: Columbia Winery 2006 Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As is most often the case with Sangiovese, this comes across as a pleasant, rather generic red wine that could be almost anything. The fruit tastes of light cherry and plum, with a rather sour finish. Tannins are earthy and there is a hint of sweaty saddle as well.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: If we've tasted a Chilean Sangiovese before, then this doubles our control group. It's very New World in style, with rich, smoky black fruit aromas leading to a fresh but full-bodied palate. We wouldn't compare this to Chianti in any way except for the grape. It's much fruitier, bigger, rounder and ultimately more generic. But it's still alluring if you're desperate for something new.
Name: TerraMater 2006 Limited Release Sangiovese (Maipo Valley)

Description: Tart and zesty, with lime and cranberry aromas and flavors. It's light, clean   and refreshing.
Designation: The Y Series Limited Release Rosé
Name: Yalumba 2007 The Y Series Limited Release Rosé Sangiovese (South Australia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's quite different from the winery's inaugural 2005 Sangiovese, with more sweet cranberry fruit and chewy, peppery tannins. It's got both muscle and spice, with a sweet, cotton candy core that is buttressed with the power of   the lengthy finish that adds layers of fat and cocoa.
Name: Trio Vintners 2006 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean, crisp and dry, this gentle rosé has a light and pretty strawberry candy color and the flavors follow right along, with a citrusy snap in the acids.
Name: Waterbrook 2007 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is sweet, plummy and just a bit over-ripe, leaning into a sugary finish. The Sangiovese fruit is almost candied, with a finish like red hots. It's an interesting effort, but it would be a difficult match to food.
Name: Tagaris 2006 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The nose on this Sangiovese should have muscle, but instead has a tired quality that extends onto the palate. The cherry and red berry flavors have a touch of spicy pepper to give them energy, but overall, are weak and slightly unbalanced. Acceptable, but lackluster.
Name: Vivác Winery 2006 Sangiovese (New Mexico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: They first made Sangio in 1999, but blended in Malbec and Syrah this year. The Malbec muscles it up; it's almost crunchy, with acidic, well-defined cranberry and cherry fruit flavors. The oak is understated; it's the fruit and acid that shine here.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wow, this is one mighty dark and smoky Sangiovese. It's got the acidity and some of the cut tobacco qualities of Italian Sangio, but at almost 15% alcohol it's definitely ramped up to New World color and concentration. The fruit sources—Elerding and Boushey—are impeccable. A little less ripeness and barrel might restore some of the missing nuances.
Name: Wineglass Cellars 2005 Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: Despite its soft entry and lightly chocolaty finish, this wine tastes unripe. There is a bitter, green tea flavor running through the tannins, and the characteristic high acidity of the Sangiovese grape is exaggerated to the point of taking over.
Name: Merry Cellars 2005 Sangiovese (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Sangio, has soft, seductive fruit and meat flavors. As it sits in the glass scents of tobacco and rose petals come into play, but in the mouth it's all about butterscotch and strawberries. Nicely done.
Name: Des Voigne 2005 San Remo Seven Hills Vineyard Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hard and tannic, this doesn't show much in the way of varietal character. There's a hint of red fruit, some tar and rubber, and a thin, somewhat stemmy finish.
Name: Covington 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is Sangiovese stretched to the max, with raisiny, pruny fruit flavors that lead into smoke, burnt rubber and tar. Rough and tumble stuff.
Name: Claar 2003 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pure Sangiovese, it shows the lighter colors of the grape, and offers quite soft, round fruit flavors of plum and ripe strawberry. Full-bodied (for Sangio) and almost lush, it's a user-friendly style that de-emphasizes the grape's natural acidity and ripens it to almost 15% alcohol. There's not a lot of detail here, just round, sweet fruit.
Name: Walter Dacon 2005 Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Description: Inspired by a trip to Tuscany, Hamilton planted Sangiovese in the mid-1990s, and while this wouldn't be mistaken for Chianti, it does have Sangiovese's classic cherry and tobacco flavors. It's less full-bodied than the other Hamilton offerings, making it more of a picnic red, or one to pair with chicken rather than steak. Multiple U.S. importers.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2005 The Mongrel Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a perfectly drinkable wine, with good fruit from a great vineyard. It's a bit minty and chalky; let's say rustic. The mixed flavors border on the lightly vegetal side of cool-climate fruit; not sweet but firm.
Name: Andrew Will 2005 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This light rosé is scented with rosewater, melon and strawberry. Finished dry and nicely structured.
Name: Waterbrook 2006 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The color is very pretty, and the wine a bit tight. As it opens up it is surprisingly chewy, leafy and slightly hot at 14.1% alcohol. Perhaps from young vines?
Name: Trio Vintners 2005 Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Good vineyard sources—Ranch at the End, Chandler Reach and Willow Crest—but the bitter, leathery flavors impact all these wines. Here it's less intrusive than in the Barbera, but it still fouls the finish with bacterial funk. Somewhere in here is some pretty cherry fruit.
Name: Yellow Hawk Cellar 2004 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is just three quarters Sangiovese, with 13% Syrah and 11% Cabernet Sauvignon (the most ever) added. Dark, silky, young and tart, it is packed with berries, cranberries, pie cherries and a dark streak mixing coffee and black pepper. This is quite young, tight and yet polished.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2005 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a 10-year-old Wahluke Slope vineyard comes this impressive Sangio. The blend includes 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Tasted along with a Sangiovese selling for almost four times the price, it stood up quite well. The wine is a beautiful plummy color, fragrant and fruity, lovely in the mouth, tasting of fresh plums and strawberries. There is good concentration and a tangy snap to the finish.
Name: RiverAerie 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Maury Balcom vineyard, this is a dry, fruit-forward rosé, finished at a pleasing 12.4% alcohol. It's a forward, fruity, lightly spicy springtime quaffer, packed with strawberry flavor. Slightly bigger and bolder, but perhaps less detailed, than the 2005 version.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2006 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sangiovese-based blend, which also includes 10% Merlot and a bit of the two Cabs, used to be labeled ‘Rosso'. It is quite ripe, almost cooked, and its flavors are round, sweet, warm, soft and almost tropical. This is not your typical Sangio, what with its flavors of bananas and cherries, and just a hint of tobacco.
Name: Lone Canary 2004 Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Sangiovese from Candy Mountain, and it's a fine follow-up to the 2004. At this young stage the barrel toast is front and center, although it's all second-fill barrels. The fruit shows a lot of spice, light plummy red flavor, and a bit of peppery herb. Simple, easy-drinking wine, without a lot of varietal presence.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Maryhill's Proprietor's Reserve bottling features heavy barrel toast and more extraction than the regular Sangiovese. It is very soft, very approachable, smooth and sweet, with a finish that tastes of strawberries and cream. Definitely a consumer-pleasing style.
Name: Maryhill 2004 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is already quite soft, oxidized and mature. It's a pleasant take on Sangiovese, absolutely ready to drink and approachable with warm, raisiny fruit flavors. There's a soft, chocolaty landing that keeps the tannins easy also. But there's not much character and no real stuffing here.
Name: Maryhill 2004 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is not a truly dry style; the relatively low (11.6%) alcohol is backed with a palate impression that is a bit sweet, but the wine retains enough acid to provide balance. It's a forward, fruity, round and flavorful, consumer-friendly style. It would work well with spicy food if served chilled.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Rosé of Sangiovese Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: A disappointing effort that's perfumed and herbal on the nose, then shows plenty of weight on the palate, but not much intensity of flavor.
Name: Yalumba 2006 Y Series Rosé Sangiovese (South Australia)

Description: Winemaker Seillan prefers not to use much new oak with Sangiovese, and this wine is more than 80% Sangiovese, so the fruit shines through. Sour cherries and tobacco are classic Chianti flavors and they're here, picking up darker notes of loamy earth and a hint of charcoal on the finish.
Name: Tenuta di Arceno 2003 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Opening aromas are a bit reductive, with some hints of tar and rubber, but underneath is firm, well-rounded fruit. This is 100% Sangio, rather heavily extracted and hence tannic, with some of the acid knocked down but the distinctive subtlety of the grape not in evidence. It comes across as a sort of younger sibling to Lemberger.
Name: Kestrel 2004 Estate Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: Ruffino's Montalcino estate, Greppone Mazzi is—in our opinion—the source for the company's best wine. Cedary cigar box aromas are backed by layers of black cherry and plum fruit and a velvety mouthfeel. The finish is long and lush, yet structured. Drink 2008–2020.
Name: Ruffino 2001 Greppone Mazzi  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Ruffino's most famous label is the gold-label Chianti Classico Riserva Ducale, first produced in 1947. The 2001 rendition capably maintains the tradition, combining coffee, prune and tobacco scents with flavors of ripe plums and dark earth.
